Reviews.Title: “They iron your clothes...”
Reviews.Author: Mommawake
Reviews.Content: Omni is trying harder! The rooms are large suites with a completely separate room area , a wet bar, large desk and chair with servi bar. Just be sure to join the complimentary Omni club to receive free in room wifi, free beverages to the room at breakfast and the option for co plimentary pressing of your clothes. I liked everything EXCEPT the price of in room snacks, I expect ServiBar prices to be inflated. BUT $7.50 for a liter of water is steep by my standards. I guess they have to recoup on some level. Overall, I would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great suites”
Reviews.Author: haparev
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I got a room at the Omni for one night on hotwire.com for what seemed reasonable for the area. It was so great we might try to stay there again. We got a large suite next to the elevators. The room was very quiet - we couldn't hear the elevators or other guests. The bedroom has an older tv and we couldn't pick up any WiFi on a consistent basis, but the flat-screen tv in the living room area and the comfortable furniture were great. It was close by the bar/lounge where we met our friends, and the bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom was quite nice, although a little dark. Overall a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: dklskgray
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 3 teenagers and loved to be right in the heart of the Michigan mile. Stayed over St. Patrick's Day. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. We joined the omni club so our room wifi was free (was removed from the bill later when we gave them our id number). Pool was too small to interest teenagers but not much does ; ) Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nicely Appointed Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LynnDVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights, first time to Chicago. Took the train in from Midway and will take the train back to OHare, Simple to do, forget the taxi, only set you back 2.25! This hotel is within walking distance to everything you want to see and do in the windy city. Nice to have the seperate sitting area from the bedroom. Beds are comfy and clean. Bathrooms are nice, not luxurious, but granite and tile, clean with lovely bath soaps and lotions. Become a member of the Omni loyality program and get free WiFi and daily delivered coffee/tea to your room, nice touch! The work out room is smallish but adequate, the pool is for kiddies! Not an adult lap swimming pool. Would definitely recommend to friends or family.They apparently have a shuttle service within a few miles to drop you off to your destination, we did not use. Also the concierge was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler23Chicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We had no complaints. The staff was professional and courteous. The room was nice. I could see some updating in the future for this hotel, but overall not bad at all. The room was very clean. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: ravesko
Reviews.Content: We find it hard to believe that this is a 4.5 star property. We often stay at 5 stars and due to pricing, figured we could get better bang for the buck staying at the Omni, which was about $100 - $150 less than the 5 star properties. Unfortunately, we were wrong. Here's a quick summary: The Good -location - very close to the shops of Michigan Ave and lots of excellent restaurants in the area (bars, pizza joints, Italian, you name it) -friendly service - people working here were genuinely pleasant and friendly The Bad -had difficulty finding an outlet to charge my phone in the bedroom area of the suite - when it serves as my alarm, need it close by -TV in bedroom area was an old box....the nice TV was in the suite -cleaning of room wasn't that great from day to day -dated decor -rooms are VERY dark The Ugly -iron kept leaking water -white drapes had brownish red stains -parking is $54 a day....wow...unreal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ptripsussex
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for six nights in February, visiting from the UK. Everything about the hotel was good. Late arrival after flight so tired - fast easy check in, relaxed but professional staff in bar. Door staff really helpful - eg tips for good breakfast diner. Location is good. Minor criticism - web site doesn't really show differences in rooms, so makes choice hard + wifi erratic in room. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica M
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here, they will do everything in their power to make sure you have a comfortable stay. I needed to microwave some food and they sent me a microwave to my room at no extra charge. Everyone here is really nice! Also this hotel is in a really nice area, and you have everything near for example Millennium Park, Willis Tower, Lincoln Park Zoo, and not to mention the hotel is located on a shopping block. There is a Saks right across the street and also a lot of high profile stores. There is an amazing restaurant named "Giordano's" right around the block. Definitely try their pizza it is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: badgergirl01
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a fantastic, well-situtated hotel in downtown Chicago. We went for a long weekend and booked their "Shop the Mag Mile Package" and it was lovely. The staff is outstanding. We ate each morning in their 676 Restaurant and also had dinner there during restaurant week and it was very good. I highly recommend any Omni. Join their loyalty program for some extras.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irecouple
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at this hotel for 6 days during the New Year period. We arrived following a long flight and took a train to a station I can't remember then took a taxi from the station to the hotel. Check in was flawless and we were given a room on the 18th floor. All of the rooms in the hotel are suites. Our room was a standard suite. It was spotlessly clean and had a separate sitting room with two chairs and a coffee table. There was also a table with two chairs where someone could eat. The bed was big and very comfortable. There was plenty of wardrobe space for clothes and shoes. There was an iron and ironing board in the room. There was a large safe in the wardrobe. The shower was a shower head in the bath. There was plenty of toiletries left by staff each day if they were used. There was also a turn down service each night. We have stayed at the Omni Shoreham Hotel in Washington previously and had joined the reward program so we got complimentary drinks of our choice each morning and a newspaper, I think the turn down service could have been part of the reward program also. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food. The concierge helped us with a shopping trip to the outlet centre. The location is fantastic, right off Michigan Ave. The doormen were a little hit and miss, if seemed that if they felt there was someone more 'important' or dressed more expensively that they rushed to open the door for them first. This is not important in itself and I am well used to opening doors for myself but I don't consider that I am more important than anyone else or anyone else is more important than me. We never ordered from the room service as we felt that it was too expensive. One night we ordered in from Gino's East pizzeria. We ate also at TGI Fridays which was just around the corner. On saying all of this, I would definitely stay at the Omni Chicago again. I find the hotels in this chain warm and inviting with pleasant staff. It was slightly expensive but we were paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Suite!”
Reviews.Author: cchase89
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to Chi-town for daughter's bday. Lucked into a suite at the Omni. Central location to all of the places she wanted to see -- American Girl, Museums and the Lakefront. The concierge was great to help us organize our agenda and maximize our time in the city. Rooms were perfect for a family trip, living room and separate bedroom. Allowed kids to crash after a long day and gave us time relax.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBobbymcgee
Reviews.Content: The Omni Chicago on Michigan ave is a fantaastic hotel! The rooms are a little on the small side but I guess thats the price you pay for being right on Miracle Mile. The Omni was a little on the pricy side but again, you get what you pay for. Great walking distance to everything on miracle mile, navy pier, John Hancock tower and easy L Access to Wrigley Field. I would definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ButchChicago
Reviews.Content: Ask for a corner room. Small but very cool rooms. Relaxed cocktail lounge above Michigan Aveenue.

Reviews.Title: “Older rooms, good service.”
Reviews.Author: candychi
Reviews.Content: The rooms have had some updating but were a little tired (ink stain on the carpet, etc) but the service was very good. Everyone was friendly upon our arrival and we were pleased with room service. While it's not the most deluxe hotel, it is very nice and I would stay there again. The bed was just okay and could definitely be updated. Location is excellent. We could look right out of our window on Michigan Ave. at the Apple store across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Rglow
Reviews.Content: The Omni Chicago is a very nice hotel. The only problem is that there are a lot of very nice hotels in Chicago. We booked a corner room, and it was nice. It had a window above the headboard of the bead, which was kind of neat. The room was small, but omni was upfront about that by telling you the sq ft on their websitie(I think 400sqft). It is called a suite, but it is no bigger than most other hotel rooms. What makes it a suite is just that instead of leaving it as one normal size room, they have made it into 2 separate small rooms separated by french doors. It does have 2 TVs, but the one in the bedroom is a rather small tube tv. We requested an upper floor twice, but only received the 11th, I think the hotel has 25 or more floors. We did not notice any areas of concern in cleanliness. The bed was decent. The fitness room was large and had a lot of equipment. The hotel does have a small pool. Having a pool is more rare than you might expect in downtown Chicago. The hot tub was broken when we were there, but the pool was warm. The hotel has 24 hour room service, which did come in handy for us. The location is great if you want to do shopping, but it's not the best area for nightlife. We paid 249 for a corner suite that included parking and $50 in breakfast food credit. That price put it at the upper end of hotels in it's class for these dates. The rooms don't seal very well from the hall. Noise and conversation can be heard in your room, though, overall the halls were quiet. Bottom Line. There are a lot of nice hotels in Chicago, this is one of them. If you choose Omni you'll surely be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jeannem52
Reviews.Content: I chose the Omni Chicago for our recent trip to Chicago because of the great location, its excellent value, instant rewards program and indoor pool. My husband and I traveled with 2 other couples and we were all very pleased with the beautiful suite accomodations, and the friendliness and courtesy of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very good ( but not great) hotel in a GREAT city”
Reviews.Author: RespiraPanama
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the Apple store in Michigan Avenue's magnificent mile, the property is very well located right in the heart of the city. Spacious rooms. Breakfast facility with nice decoration and food, though less variety of options in the buffet than what I would expect for a 5-star facility. Kind but less than charming attention. Chicago, on the other hand, is one of the best "all around" cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel That's Really Operates on "Service"”
Reviews.Author: AskDrReg
Reviews.Content: Please allow me to say that my issues were resolved with top speed and with professionalism. The person I credit with articulating the issues and having them resolved so quickly is Ms. Jackie (The Operator). I explained to her that I had problems with my heat in the room and that it was very cold. She was able to get me assistance almost before I got off the line. I needed a refrigerator for my food and she was able to get me one to the room by the time I came back from Walgreens. The engineer was Bryan. I didn't believe he was the engineer because he looked so young, but he took care of my issue within few minutes and I was able to get to bed at a reasonable time in warmth. One final person I will applaud for excellent service is Alice, Front Desk. She was the first person I encountered and my check-in was done with care and flawless. When I got to my room and unpacked, I realized that I did not bring my laptop power cord. I went to the desk and she told me that she would look in to helping me and get back with me. I asked for information on a couple of clothing stores, because I did not pack a white shirt for my interview and she was exceptional in both names of discount stores and their exact location. The resounding theme of these three associates is their uncanny level of professionalism and can-do attitude. I travel over 80% of the year and this was my first stay at your hotel but I can guarantee that it will not be the last. As a member of the travel community (Travel Agent), I look for lodging partners where I can send my clients where they will be both comfortable and experience service at its best. I pray and hope that these comments are shared with the named associates and their direct supervisors. It is rare to encounter people who treat you like one of the family. Thanks for taking time to review my comments.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: santorini97
Reviews.Content: My friends & I stayed in 2 rooms at the Omni over Christmas. The room are decorated beautifully, the hotel staff was wonderful, and the location can't be beat (near Water Tower Place, the Apple Store) and all the other wonderful stores on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Farles82
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the middle of everything. Location is perfect to walk to all the hot spots in downtown Chicago. Only need a cab to and from the airport. I had stayed at the Omni a couple of times before and I would have to say the room could have used some updating, but it was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chigie2
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. The staff is wonderful. Our room was a corner room overlooking Mi Ave which is beautiful. Breakfast buffet was one of the best. Definitely a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Mile and Magnificant Hoteel and Room”
Reviews.Author: Greg34au
Reviews.Content: This was my very first stay in the USA. I travelled from Sydney and spent 23 hours in transit. Upon getting a shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel I was greeted so warmly by the concierge and staff, the temperature was -12 c outside and was given outstanding service with a smile. The check-in was seamless and was awarded free Wi-Fi as I had joined the loyalty program. I stayed one night in the windy city, and I think was by far my greatest experience in the USA. Was given a room on Level 12 with a view of the John Hancock building. Location is fantastic, located just off the Magnificent Mile in a side street, very quiet and easy walking distance to Navy Pier, John Hancock building and Maceys. The room was very well appointed and comfortable, air conditioning was warm and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable almost as good as the one at Grand Hotel Melbourne and that is saying volumes. Breakfast in the room was a bagel and fresh smoothie, arrived on time, setup in my room and pleasant. TV Reception was great and had plenty of channels to view. You really cannot go wrong with this hotel, itâ€™s a company favorite and for very very good reason, I was hard pressed to find anything wrong, actually nothing it was perfect. I think I paid $ 189.00 US per night, which I though was very reasonable considering 1) Location 2) Staff friendless and professionalism 3) Quality of furnishings 4) Attention to detail

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Diane P
Reviews.Content: i stayed M-F and had a very good experience. The entire staff was friendly and ready to lend a hand in anyway. The lobby is on the third floor with the restaurant on the fourth -- convenient and good. My room was a suite with a large bathroom, The location of the hotel is terrific! Valet parking is available or you can self-park a block and a half a way. I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: vincetraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Omni Hotel with our two kids 5 and 8 years old. We had a room with two queen size beds and a separate room with sofa and desk,fridge, keetle and two Flat screen. The room was big enough and the only noise we had we the Air conditioner and few ambulance and police cars from the street. The pool was fine but the water too warm. We had few breakfast and dinner and the food and the service was very good and professional.The place is well located close to downtown and shops. Wifi was not free in the room and this is pity. A place to recommend

Reviews.Title: “The Chicago Omni: Adequate. (And Unremarkable.)”
Reviews.Author: eva2691
Reviews.Content: Based on others' reviews, I was excited to stay at the Omni on Michigan Avenue, but aside from being safe, clean, and in a good location, it wasn't particularly memorable (except for the loudly-barking dog in a room two doors down; a call to the front desk did nothing to silence the noise.) Our "suite" was tiny and the decor plain; there were few amenities of which to speak. The hotel layout is odd and disjointed (front desk on the third floor, overpriced bar and restaurant on the fourth, bellmen on the first.) While the staff was certainly professional, this property just seemed to lack any personality whatsoever, and in a city with so many other hotels to choose from, I think I will, next time my travels take me to the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni, once a year for a few years. Cannot believe the staff actually remembers us! This hotel for our family just cannot be beat! The staff is first rate, so attentive! The rooms are perfect for a family with a large bathroom and separate living area. The rooms are always spotless and the bathroom stocked. Join the Omni rewards program, it is free and gets you lots of free goodies. Will continue to stay here. Check out Travelzoo for great rates too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gabbyr7
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, right on magnificent mile with great shopping and restaurants at your doorstep.The staff were friendly and obliging and the food in the restaurant was very nice. The kids loved thier Omni gift packs and felt really special. Overall we would not hesitate to stay again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Professional30m
Reviews.Content: Great all suite hotel right in the middle of Michigan Ave shopping! Rooms are very clean and spacious with separate living room and bedroom. The corner suite we had was quiet and spacious. Staff was friendly, welcoming and extremely helpful from check-in to check-out. Doorman recognized my wife and I after the first day, and always asked how our day was, or if we had any questions/plans for the day, etc. We even struck up a bit of a conversation once or twice. Take advantage of joining the Omni Select Guest (free) and you will receive complimentary drinks every morning delivered to your door, free WiFi, and even free shoe shines if you want! Best of all, the great shops of Michigan are right at your doorstep. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Well deserving of the 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Ryan F
Reviews.Content: I could not describe this hotel as anything less than awesome without being deceitful. I traveled with my girlfriend for a 5 night stay & we both agreed this was an all around great hotel. The attentive service was definitely a highlight - from booking to chekcout they made everything a quick & efficient breeze & did it with a smile. The concierge was polite and was happy to make suggestions and then call for the reservations (which we ended up loving!). Room service was so quick - order drinks, they'll be at your door in 5 minutes, no joke. We would always make a mess of the room in the evening/night & returning from breakfast to an impeccable turned down room was pretty cool, they'll even fold the clothes you leave out. Accidentally left $78 cash on the table the first day & it was still there on the last day. Even the valets were great - they would run, like literally sprint, to make sure you never had to open a door for yourself hahah. Valets, front desk, concierge, room service, all great & personable service. Wifi is a bit pricy ($14 I think?), but very fast Other positives on the the stay would be the big bathrooms, comfy beds, 676 restaurant (tasty!) - really great cheese & salted meats and shockingly one of the best burgers of my life, adequate workout facility (needs bigger dumbells), and nice deck outside the pool. If I had to nitpick, there are a FEW minor issues that I would like to see improved. 1) unfortunately the hot tub was closed during our stay (1/5/12-1/10/12) I think the intake valves weren't up to city code or something.. bummer. 2) the business center has some slightly ridiculous prices. It cost me $10 to log on & print tickets for the Shedd. 3) The view wasn't spectacular for my room - we were blocked by he newly erected Ritz-Carlton residences. Oh well, the obstructed view was still pretty nice. 4) They need a better bottle selection for the room service For the people complaining about the 2 elevators, STOP WHINING! It takes a whole extra 30 seconds to switch elevators and this way you don't have god knows who wandering up to your floor as they have to pass hotel staff 3 times before getting to the rooms. Once again, so pleased with our stay. Recommend it 110%. We loved it as a couple, but it seems great for families as well. I did one of those mystery hotels on last minute travel - Omni Hotel in a suite for $90/night. So keep in mind my review MIGHT the biased by paying like 60% off hahah As a side note, places we recommend Restaurants: -Everest ($$$$$$) fine french food 40 stories above chicago. SO expensive, but if you're determined to be luxurious, I would go for it. It's an experience for certain. Bring a sportcoat - formal dining room -Roka Akor: great sushi and contemporary asian. Do a sake flight -Grand Luxe Cafe: biggest. restaurant. ever. So much selection. I think we said we wished we ordered that to everything that came out of the kitchen -Signature Room & Lounge: dinner & drinks at the 95th & 96th floor of the hancock building. Absoulutely humbling awesome 360 degree view. Kind of pricey but 100% worth it. You can go & get drinks for the same price as the skydeck and its a better view. Hennesy martini - 'nuff said -Billy Goat Tavern: you'll never get a better burger in your life. Chicago classic. Lunch for $5 -Gino's/Giordano's/Lou Malnati's - all great chicago style pizza. Yes, we tried all 3 -676: as lame as it sounds to recommend the hotel's restaurant, it was one of the better meals we had & its not tooo pricey. Get the cheeses and meaths - very good. Hit up the shedd & art musuem. Navy pier isn't as cool as everyone makes it out to be, but go by at night and ride the ferris wheel. We went to a show at the Shakespeare theatre on the pier. Very intimate theatre & excellent performance. Skating at the rink in millenium park is cute, but go on a weekday or it will be packed with tweens trying to skate their stuff. The big metal bean in the park is fun too. Walk michigan ave - cool buildings, shops, and food. You can have fun their without even spending money Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Break”
Reviews.Author: Boybee
Reviews.Content: We recently spent Dec. 30 and 31st at the Omni to celebrate the holidays. We had a corner suite and it was really nice and spacious. The living room could use an additional chair and the wet bar, although convenient was limited. We had a problem with the bedroom TV, which was repaired very quickly. The breakfast buffet is very good, with many selections to choose. One issue we had was the other couple we went with received a $25 voucher for each night of their stay...we asked the desk upon check in and were told that we did not get the same deal as our friends, even thought we both booked the same type of room, paid the same rate, and made reservations directly through the hotel. Finally, the parking rate of $52 per day is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Chicago great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: 365dpificould
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Chicago (downtown) on Huron and Michigan ave, accross the street from the Apple store. We stayed in a premier suite with two double beds.(Very clean, great bed linens, comfy.) The room had plenty of room for the four of us, all grownups. It had one bed room with two double beds, a door that would close if need be. A pull out couch for additional sleeping.(3 people sitting one sleeping.) Two TVs, one very large bathroom and sink area, with a frig. The room was spotless, with a side view of Michigan ave and a roof-top garden illuminated in lights. We had Brunch at their 676 Restaurant, $20,00 per person offering an omlet bar, waffles, fresh frust, bursting with both meat and non meat entrees as well. It satified the pickiest eaters and hollow leg eaters alike. The other food items where priced not too shocking for a downtown hotel.( ie, oatmeal $8.00) The Omni is located in an electric area close to shopping, financial district and theatre area. I have stayed downtown plenty, but I really enjoy this location on the avenue for accessability. I have not compared pricing for parking, however due to Chicago raising the recent parking meters, we felt it was easiest to utilize the valet parking at $52.00 per night. We will hopfully return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Break in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sparky-1967
Reviews.Content: The Omni has a very good standard and the friendliest staff. Sign up for the Omniâ€™s Select Guest program; it gives you added benefits such as free WiFi and morning beverages. We had stayed previously at the Chicago Omni, which was a very nice experience. The Hotel was extremely busy during the Christmas Break and we did notice a large number of families with small children, which added to the noise levels. Being a returning guest and a Select Guest member on a coupleâ€™s trip, we were hoping for a higher room with fewer children on the floor, which is noted in our profile. Unfortunately, we were not able to get a room that met our requests. Although this trip did not meet with the same level of satisfaction as our previous trip, it was a nice stay. The room we received was nice and extremely clean. The service was excellent. Room Service was timely and the food was hot and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: JohanPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas with our children and grandkids in Chicago. We chose the Omni for it's reasonable rates and location. The rooms were good. The staff were exceptional. Despite working on Christmas Day they were all very very friendly and efficient. ....every single one without exception. We will go back there in summer for a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Spent 1 night”
Reviews.Author: WiMommyof3
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at this property to celebrate our anniversary the day after Thanksgiving. We were able to check in early at 11:30 am and head out for some Black Friday shopping. The hotel is very close to the epicenter of shopping. All of the rooms are suites (on the small side, but nice still), and we enjoyed having a dvd player to play a movie (we never seem to have time at home with 3 young kids, so this was great). The rooms could use some updated furnishings, but the bed was still heavenly. Roomy bath also. We ate at the breakfast buffet the next morning. Also wonderful. We had a late checkout so we were able to relax for a good while after breakfast (it was rainy out, and we were done shopping). Will stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel steps from Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: ButterBee29
Reviews.Content: Took a weekday trip to Chi town to relax and enjoy some shopping for the holidays. the Omni is a great bet as its steps (literally) from Mich Ave and the great shops (located across the street from the Apple store). I will say I'm a bit biased as I travel to Chicago as often as I can for business as its one of my favorite cities. Omni is a nice hotel for the price. Be sure to join the free rewards club thing as it gives you free coffee and tea service delievered to your door in the morning (to your specified time...hang the ticket on the door and its there in the morning). I can't speak to the coffee ( taste wise) but the tea service was wonderful. Walk two blocks south on Mich to Ann Taylor/ Loft and turn right. About two blocks down on left is great inexpensive place for breakfast (huge...so it lasts until dinner)...its called Eggsexperience. Sorry, back to the hotel. I didn't spend a lot of time in the room...but its centrally located, our room as quite (even located next to the elevator), the bed was comfy and the WiFi worked great. The free water (with member club thing) was pretty bad...more of a taste perference thing...some people are fine with it. The ammenties in the bathroom were nice and I liked that the sliding doors that allowed DH to get ready while I slept (without the light on and water running in the same room). Make a reservation at Volare for a truely great dinner (couple blocks from hotel)...skip House of Blues as food is awful and this time when we went for drinks and to listen to the band in the bar they had a cover charge. Not worth it as there are more than a few great FREE places to enjoy music and jazz in Chi Town.

Reviews.Title: “Too potent air freshener”
Reviews.Author: cs7sisters
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice, except for the very potent air freshener smells in the lobbies, halls, and rooms. We asked not to spray the room, which they didn't, but the smells from former stays still bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Some Rooms Are Outdated”
Reviews.Author: HopALongHari
Reviews.Content: For a 4.5 star hotel I was disappointed. The location is great since it's on the main strip with a fleet of other hotels. However, the exact cross street that this hotel is on was very tricky to find and navigate. I got lost multiple times with my rental finding the hotel, it was quite frustrating as it's huge and very visible from the street. I was upgraded to a suite when I checked in but found the suite to be a bit outdated. The cable television was the worst quality I have ever seen in a hotel or motel. It's as if the signal was coming from the basement and had been split 405 times to feed into every room. And yes, when I travel for leisure I do sometimes zone out in front of the hotel TV to relax. I had the requisite extra charges and mistakes on my bill upon checking out for items I supposedly took from the minibar. This is a frequent complaint for this hotel if you check on other hotel review websites. My friend who is a Chicago native said that the Omni is very impressive when it comes to their conferences rooms and catering but I didn't see any of that. During my stay the service was just okay and very uneven but not befitting the reputation of the Omni. The first woman checking me in was professional, the bellboy seemed a little green but earnest, and everyone else that I spoke with on the phone had an attitude and didn't seem to want to be of help. Not 4.5 star service at all. The lobby of the hotel is grand but also very nondescript. The entire hotel seems to be painted with a forgettable, universal 'big hotel' circa 2000 paint brush. If the service were more fitting of its star rating and more consistent I would rate this hotel higher. Would not stay here again unless I found a good deal on a booking site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere_Didntdoit
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this property although I have tried many other hotels in the area. Check-in for a group was relatively painless. We arrived early and they held our bags until that afternoon when we could get our rooms. The lobby is actually on the third floor. There is a unusual arrangement where you take one set of elevators to the lobby and move to another bank of elevators to get up to the rooms. At the least this is awkward but the elevators are reasonably fast and I never had a long wait for a car. The room(s) are good size. The suite has a separate bedroom with doors and a large bathroom. There is a TV in the main living area as well as the bedroom although there is a mediocre selection of channels. Pay per view is available at EXORBITANT prices. There was a wet bar in the room setup with a coffee maker. The mini-fridge was locked but I assume any items there would have been reasonably priced like the $7.50 bottle of water on the counter. I had breakfast and dinner at the hotel restaurant on the fourth floor. The dinner was quite good although the menu was rather limited. Breakfast offered a buffet or menu items. While the meal was OK (how hard is it to fry a couple eggs?), $20 for a buffet just seems wrong to me. The staff was always helpful and courteous. The hotel location on N. Michigan avenue is ideal for a shopping junket or a visit. There are also many fine restaurants within walking distance. Givin the chance I will stay here again , although I will dine elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, great location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: kimtravelgirl1974
Reviews.Content: I was there for a weekend with some family and friends. We had a great time. The hotel is in a perfect location. We liked the fact that the hotel is all suites. We were able to get 2 suites connecting which was wonderful! I lived in Chicago for several years so I was familiar with the city, but my friends took full advantage of the concierge. The employees were wonderful! They always asked us how our stay was going and if we needed anything. PROS: Spacious suites, great location, great employees, and if you are a Select guest member extra benefits. CONS: Restaurant was pricey

Reviews.Title: “Annual Shopping Trip after Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: khainley09
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay. From valet, checking in, our room, checking out, valet service- It was all excellent !! We will be staying here next year as well.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review - good and bad”
Reviews.Author: EricJohnson54_40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving 2011. We called ahead to make sure that dogs were allowed, and got "clearance" to bring a dog that weighed over their 25lb max. We were very happy about this. However, once we got to the hotel, there were many dogs that were over 25lbs, we probably saw at least 5. Not sure why I had to get special clearance, given this, but it does not matter as we were happy. Also called ahead to request a pull-out sofa and a rollaway bed. Also requested, by phone and email, a quiet room, on a high floor, with a wonderful view. When we checked in, we were in a tiny room, with no view, on a low floor, and no room whatsoever for a rollaway. When I called in advance of our stay, Rosie at the front desk told me that it would be no problem to accomodate both a rollaway and a pull-out sofa. So, had to call front desk a few times once we got there, spoke to Emmie, who was somewhat helpful and somewhat condescending, and we were moved to a room that was about a hair bigger. No upgrades were offered, even though I inquired about the "executive suite" advertised on the website, and the Governor's Suite (empty) next door to us. Emmie told me it would be $150 more a night to move next door to the bigger suite. I declined. Our rate was to include both parking and a $25 dining voucher for each night. However, when I looked at our paperwork, I noticed we were being charged for parking. So, down to the front desk I went. I showed Emmie my confirmation email which clearly showed "free parking and $25 dining certificate each night". She did not seem convinced, as she said they "get a list" and that parking was not on "the list". Again, I showed her the confirmation, and she shrugged and said "OK, I guess I'll give you free parking". Interestingly, a family moved into the Governor's Suite next door to us, the one I inquired about, and they told me that they had been upgraded for free. Go figure. We are members of the Select Guest program which means we are supposed to receive turn-down service at night with free water. This did not happen either of the two nights. We also did not receive any housekeeping services the whole stay, despite the fact that I called about it. Good: location, price, Rosie who I spoke to on the phone who works at the front desk, 676 Restaurant, Miriam, the doorman, who was excellent and very friendly. all housekeepers that you ran into in the halls were very friendly. bathroom was nice, but small. shampoo etc and towels all nice. bed reasonably comfy but not as nice as a Heavenly Bed or equivalents out there. Mediocre: front desk staff, and concierge staff during our stay. hot tub was not working b/c drain did not comply with state laws. Rooms very small and dated. Lack of housekeeping. corner suite too small for a family of 4 who needs a rollaway and has a dog. We also did not receive the Omni kids backpacks, which my kids saw other kids with. Also, the doors are VERY LOUD DOORS. They can only slam. Not "soft doors". Every time a door closes in your hall, it wakes you up. Need quieter doors or more insulation. You can also hear every word people say in the halls - not a well insulated place! perfect location though. with a facelift this place would be very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues, overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: House keeping was pretty bad, but the front desk was always good about sending stuff up. The beds were not made well, glasses were left dirty, coffee wasn't replaced.All the givens were not handled well. Not what we have come to expect from Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you might expect”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: I love the Omni in Chicago. I stay there when I travel for business, but it is an excellent place to stay for leisure as well. It has a great location on the Magnificent Mile. The staff and service is outstanding. The restaurant is very good- not great- but very good. The rooms are extremely well designed and comfortable. All around, this is a fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Spinefx1
Reviews.Content: Room was first rate. Staff courteous and friendly. Clean rooms. Bed nice. Super location on Michigan Ave. Restaurant/Bar was very good. Overall would go again after having stayed at many hotels in the downtown Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: cmuller76
Reviews.Content: Sign up at the front desk to become an Omni member for free and receive drinks delivered to your room each morning - and you get to pick from many! Staff is great here and the location is convenient to many great restaurants and shopping. Beds are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Jen P
Reviews.Content: Here are some pros and cons: Pros: -Good location -Nice staff -Clean room Cons: -Lack of bathroom amenities (I get better items at a Holiday Inn) -Housekeeping wasn't so great... 1. A bathroom rug was taken out of my room (no idea why) and never returned it. The marble floor in the bathroom was very dangerous when slippery...I had to throw towels on the ground to make sure I did not fall. 2. I was charged for items I did not take out of the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: highmain
Reviews.Content: We also didn't get a corner suite with a terrific view, but the room appeared very spacious in the common area, the bed room with 2 double beds seemed a little tight. Our room wasn't ready when we got there either. Stay was fine though. Housekeeping very responsive. Restaurant had a great breakfast buffet. Would stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: DMCRH
Reviews.Content: Slight annoyance on arrival when room not ready, but receptionist gave us a $25 food credit (put to good use at the very good outside breakfast cafe). Further disappointment upon finding that the claim that Superior Corner Suites "feature generous city views" was not borne out in our case - only the blank wall of the adjoining building - but the main advantage claimed by this hotel, namely the location, was true in every respect. We'd probably go to one of the more historical ones next time in Chicago rather than return, but that's not to say that this one was in any way a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key....”
Reviews.Author: bldpitt
Reviews.Content: to a great stay and that certainly is true of this Omni on Michigan Avenue in Chicago. Directly across from the Apple store, easy access to CTA within 5 blocks and tons of stores, dining options and tourist activities to do nearby. A well maintained property, great fitness center and pool for exercise and easy to get to lakefront for longer runs. The room we had was a corner suite---quiet, wonderful eat-looking view to see some of the lake. Well organized room, great bed!!! Service here is good, friendly staff and a real gem for Omni. Most definitely will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A great family stay!”
Reviews.Author: rlbrown77
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take a quick road trip to Chicago with our son (age 3). It was his first Chicago trip and we planned to do the museums and shopping. Booked room online, very quick and easy, lots of packages to choose from. Our son was in heaven from the time we checked in until we left. The doorman was super attentive to our son, gave him an Omni kids club backpack with some small toys in it. Every time we came in and left the hotel the doorman gave our son a high five and greeted him by name. The front desk staff was super attentive to us, including talking with our son. Upon check out, he was greeted by name. When turn down service came, they brought him milk and cookies. Room service was fast, food was very, very good. Rooms were quiet. We had a corner king suite. Perfect for traveling with a young child. Location is awesome. Only steps from Disney Store and Water Tower Place. Good eating locations nearby. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Turning 60!!!”
Reviews.Author: mpdeps
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend with my sisters and daughters and nieces to celebrate my 60th birthday. I had never been to Chicago and we had a great time. They were able to put our 3 rooms on the same floor with 2 of the rooms adjoining. Loved the sitting area since we could all hang out there. However the couch could have been more comfortable. The hotel was in a great location. The doorman, receptionists and concierge were all friendly and helpful. We also got an email from the ambassador and he was able to put our rooms together. We also enjoyed our morning coffee delivered to our rooms. The restaurant was nicely decorated and the staff helpful and friendly. The Sunday breakfast buffet was very fresh and good. Our only disappointment was the Jacuzzi was not working. We felt they should have comped us some drinks or something since we planned on using it while there. I would definitely stay there again especially if you needed a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Great Food Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: bigjoe10
Reviews.Content: Spent the week of oct 10-15 first time visiting Chicago . we took the package with valet parking & restaurant package . Everything was done with world class service from checking in to the valet!!!! We also loved the restaurant at the Omni we had the buffet in the am . we had the hamburger & sweet potato fries during the afternoon (fantastic ) , they gave us $25 dollars per day per Guest to spend the menu is reasonably priced . Wait staff at the restaurant we're AWESOME you wanted for nothing !!!! Our room was a corner room it had lots of room with a Great view of Michigan Ave!!! City of Chicago Speaks for itself Show Up & Be Moved !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: The Omni Chicago is in an excellent location close to Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile. We stayed here for more than a week in July 2011 and found the location to be the best aspect of this hotel. We found our room decor to be dated and in need of refurbishment. Although our room was a suite with a separate living area and bedroom area, both areas were quite small. Even combined, both rooms were smaller than other hotel rooms where we have stayed in Chicago and elsewhere. Our room had nice views of the Chicago skyline. We had breakfast a number of times at the hotel and found the breakfast options to be generally good. This hotel has two separate elevators, one from the ground floor to the lobby, and the other from the lobby floor to room floors. Elevator capacity was often insufficient to meet demand for elevators, which meant that we at times had a long wait for one or both elevators. In general, better options are available in the Chicago both in room size and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: KristiEMichigan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing location just steps off of MI Ave, right in the middle of all of the shopping, and not a long walk to restaurants and sights. The hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious and up to date. We had a king corner room, which was great, but they put us on the 6th floor so we had NO view, which was extremely disappointing since we were there to celebrate our anniversary. Every person we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The only con is that valet parking is the only option and it's $52/night - outrageous. Would stay here again if we could find a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bargainhuntah
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and thought that this was a great spot to be, right in the heart of the shopping district. We got a decent rate using our AAA discount. Never had a meal at the hotel restaurant, so really can't make a comment about that. We checked in late at night and didn't like the room's view and they moved us without hesitation to a better room. Very good gym and indoor pool that was hardly used by other guests. If you join their loyalty program online prior to arrival you will get perks such as, free beverages and newspaper delivery each morning and free internet in your room. Those are about a $20 savings a day! All in all a very good hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Perfect Location, Just a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: nathanmedic2003
Reviews.Content: We actually got the hotel on priceline for near $110 ... that was an outstanding deal for this area of Chicago, but to be honest, their rack rates are not so bad either, compared to the competition. You simply could not ask for a better location. You're across from the 700 N Michigan "mall" and next to Ralph Lauren, 900 N. Michigan is a two-block walk, Navy Pier is right around the corner and Water Tower Place is also easy walking distance (not to mention the rest of the Magnificent Mile). Service is where the hotel lost its fifth star. I had requested a King-size bed over the phone and been told it "shouldn't be a problem" though it was acknowledged it wouldn't be guaranteed. The clerk, when I arrived, seemed flummoxed by the request, and had to "secretly converse" (believe me, this looked as odd as it sounded) with another, apparently more experienced (or higher-ranking) front desk individual to see if "a room was available." Look, it's either there or it's not. It was obviously there, and they were making the decision as to whether to give it to me. The answer was "no". But, wait, the clerk saw a money-making opportunity! For a "small fee" (it was small about $30 plus tax), they could upgrade me to a corner room with a King bed. Since I was already paying such a low rate, I didn't mind paying the extra $30, though I was incredibly annoyed at the behavior of the front desk person. She did somewhat redeem herself by getting me and my wife free cold water (I was extremely dehydrated from a very long walk at UIC). The room was nice, though I found it a bit odd to have a flat-screen TV in the "living room" (which FELT cramped and small; still it was a suite - plenty large enough for me) and a very old CRT TV in the bedroom. I was there for both business and pleasure and got personal wake-up calls (very early) on time. A cab was promptly hailed by the ever-present bellhops/concierges/etc. For a suite, I was surprised there was no microwave or refrigerator (beyond the wet bar). The room was clean and the bathroom area was large. The coffee was, I believe, Wolfgang Puck, and was also good. I DID end up with a $9.99 charge from the mini-bar (I hadn't taken anything), but this was VERY promptly resolved (without any issues) with one simple phone call. I also left my glasses in the room, which were mailed to me at my charge (again, promptly, after just one call). I have no problem with being charged for my own carelessness. So, all in all, a great value, a great location, but some service issues still to work out. Free high-speed internet if you join the Omni frequent guest club (at no cost) ... well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “would of got a 5 but i had a few issues”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: 1)10$ per day for the internet 2) Showers were most of the time luke warm and not a lot of pressure. 3) 626 restaurant was good, but i tried sharing their buffet with my wife and they charged me double and we never went back after that. so just be careful if you decide to do that. 4) no private toilet room door. I love the staff at the OMNI, personable and very helpful. From the doormen to the concierge. The rooms were very, very clean. Ours was medium and very pleasant. Chicago is the best US city in my opinion, the food, the architecture and history and the museums are the best the US has to offer!!! Shaws seafood was the highlight, it was packed and i knew why after eating there. Oysters were EXCELLENT!!! Since it is a big city, lots of Sirens, they can get annoying after a while!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Miracle Mile shopping”
Reviews.Author: Blackhawk-Hardware
Reviews.Content: My neighbor and I stayed 4 nights at the Omni in a suite with 2 double beds. The suite was spacious. We never felt crowded. The additional sink in the wet bar made getting ready much easier. The location of the Omni cannot be topped for access to shopping and sightseeing. It was an easy walk to anyplace we wanted to go and close enough to return in the middle of the day, if needed. We walked to the restaurants at night and felt perfectly safe (two women alone). The only suggestion for the suite is to add an armchair of some kind instead of just having the sofa. The suite was up to date and very clean and inviting. The staff at this hotel is so friendly and very helpful. They added to the pleasure of our stay. We were so pooped on Saturday night that we just had a drink at the bar. We ended up ordering the tomato and white bean soup, too. It is one of the best soups I have ever tasted!! It was accompanied by a plate of fresh breads and butter plus a slice of toasted Italian bread topped by goat cheese and tomato. Delicious!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a city!”
Reviews.Author: CraftBuddie
Reviews.Content: Him Indoors and I just spent 9 days in Chicago, staying at the Omni on the Magnificent Mile. From the bellhops to reception, from restaurant to cleaning, the staff were invariably friendly, warm and helpful and I'd like to offer congratulations to the management of the hotel on the quality of their team. The hotel itself is clean and modern and is in a superb location for exploring the central parts of the city including the Loop and the Magnificent Mile/State Street area. Our room on the 21st floor was a good size and the staff even provided us with a mini fridge. Buffet breakfast included options to suit all tastes and we found that we really didn't need to eat again until evening. The restaurant is really very good. Free wi-fi is available in the lobby and it would be nice if this was extended to the whole hotel. Chicago is a very friendly city and people readily offered help any time we looked lost. The public transport system is excellent, frequent and easy to follow. We bought a travel pass for just $23 that gave unlimited journeys on the buses and elevated railway and we made much use of the system. We enjoyed a baseball game at iconic Wrigley Field and we were lucky enough to attend the opening football game of the season at Soldier Field, which was on the 10th anniversary of 9/11, and the pre-game commemoration was quite emotional. All in all, we loved our visit and we'd highly recommend Chicago as a destination for Brits and other Europeans thinking of visiting the States. And we'd certainly recommend the Omni for its location, comfort and warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned !! $9.99 charge for the bottled water !!”
Reviews.Author: Balloons2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about this hotel. The location is excellent, the staff very welcoming, The room very clean and comfortable until we were given a bill at the end of our stay for nearly $30. Was told initially it was for Wi-Fi and as i was a select member the charge would be dropped.The charge remained on my credit card and after a few emails they now tell me its a charge for the water !!This water is no special water !! It is sitting on a counter along side the tea and coffee facilities ( Not in the mini bar where all chargeable items should be) which are free so be careful and be warned if you drink the water it will cost you $9.99 a bottle !!! Very disappointing in how this matter has been handled !!

Reviews.Title: “Distinctive service; fantastic location; all the rooms are suites (even if a bit gloomy)”
Reviews.Author: Airlineconsultant
Reviews.Content: With over 500 previous reviewers of the Omni, it is hard to make fresh comments that future potential guests might find helpful. For me, the front desk check in experience was distinctive â€“ Briana truly could not have gone more out of her way to find me a suitable room (away from elevators, with a view) and this is something that I have experienced very rarely; a great example of an employee taking initiative and going beyond the call of duty. It turned out that Briana had just transferred three weeks previously from another Omni property in the south-east; great to see a company like Omni offering their employees the opportunity to move around their myriad of properties. As many reviewers have commented, you cannot get better located than the Omni, in the middle of the Miracle Mile, with a beach about 10 minutes walk away, lakeside walk/bike path 10 minutes, the nearest L stop 5 minutes and the Navy pier, Art Museum and Loop areas about 15 minutes. All the designer/big brand name stores are within 2 to 10 minutes walk. By my reckoning, you should be able to see the lake from about floor 22 upwards for those rooms facing north (2301, 2303, 2305, 2309 â€“ and the same on floors 24 and 25). But rooms on the front right (eg 04,06) will be looking straight into the new Ritz Carlton residences being built next door (so close it seems as though you could almost touch them). I liked the suite-approach of the room â€“ probably very few hotels will offer an all-suite proposition in downtown Chicago. There is a fridge (albeit stocked to the hilt with the hotelâ€™s fully priced beverages), coffee machine, etc. An unusual room item was a can of spray starch. The safe was about half a foot off the ground, which meant crouching down to access it (but it was large enough to hold a laptop). The room is a bit on the gloomy side â€“ this is because the small-ish windows have darkened glass, plus no ceiling/wall lights (just a couple of table lamps). You can switch lifts on either floor 3 (reception) or floor 4 (bar/restaurant level). Virtually all hotels in Chicago have their main lobby on an elevated level (I quite like this â€“ makes it more private somehow). There is an out-door deck on level 5 (go through the gym to access it), although because of all the other skyscrapers the sun is blocked for a fair amount of the day. The nearest supermarket is Whole Foods (just three blocks to the west); fantastic food at not such fantastic prices. For more basic items, go to Walgreens. Starbucks is everywhere. The CTA train to the airport (Oâ€™Hare) is about 1 hour 15 minutes door-to-door but very straightforward, even with luggage; the blue line to/from Oâ€™Hare does stop at an awful lot of train stations. The transfer at Jackson to the red line is easy. Consider buying a pass eg 7 days unlimited CTA travel is just $23. Two areas of Chicago I particularly enjoyed were the Old Town Triangle plus Damen/Wicker Park. A picture of the Omni from the top of the Willis Tower is attached. It is the building with the curved roof, to the front right of the Hancock Tower â€“ the other side of the Magnificant Mile from the signed Allerton hotel. You can see the red crane of the right-up-close Ritz Carlton residences next to it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: MicroBunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for icaac. Clean, quiet room. Friendly and helpful staff. Close to shopping and some restaurants

Reviews.Title: “excellent suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerardYvelines
Reviews.Content: we spent six days in Chicago, visiting .Location of Omni is perfect, it is close to all shops on N Michigan , a lot of good restaurants available in the neighborhood.Metro is not very far, to get downtown. Room was great, a suite with a lounge/office part comprising a large flat TV, and a queen bedroom part, with another TV.Numerous amenities, wifi in the room is free for loyalty customers -enrolment is free but must be made prior to connection-, room service excellent. Front desk , concierge are extremely helpful and friendly, to organize car rental or restaurant reservations. A courtesy car is available, upon prior reservation, for a free city drop off .We utilized it to get to the science museum, at the other end of the city. altogether, a very good place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanicePetrolia
Reviews.Content: From our first greeting by the Concierge staff to our final check out at the Front Desk we felt welcome and valued. Rooms were spacious and well appointed. Location was super convienent to all attractions and great room service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: kinch1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by getting an e-mail from Omni after staying in one of their hotels elsewhere. What a great location, great value and great service, Highly recommend. It's our new first choice for when we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Chicago-Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelerof1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the busy July 4th weekend in a Superior Corner Suite w/King (with sofabed in living room). We were on a high floor facing Michigan Ave, but no view other than the adjacent buildings. The main draw of the hotel is its position on Michigan Avenue. It's easy to get to everything that is necessary (food, shopping, entertainment) via walking, bus, or a short cab ride. The overall appearance of the hotel from lobby to the room was OK. It was nice but I didn't get that WOW factor when I entered the hotel or my room. It was clean, a little on the smaller side for a suite but it sufficed, no fridge or microwave (though we did request and got a fridge even though it was late Friday nite). Service was great. Whatever the request, it was granted quickly which is impressive considering that the hotel was fully booked. Ordered room service for lunch and loved the chicken wings with the Asian chile sauce! Portion size was very generous for everything ordered and they were quick. Definitely join their loyalty rewards program for the free wifi, ironing, and morning beverage delivery. Doormen were very helpful and friendly. Oh one weird thing about the room design was TV placement. We were watching tv in the living room and the channels start changing randomly. One of our travel companions inadvertently changed the channels of our television in the living room even though she was in the bedroom with the french doors closed. We had a good laugh once we realized what was happening. I would stay at an Omni property again because I've heard that some of the properties have a more luxurious feel, but I can't say that I'd choose the Chicago property for my next trip (even though service was outstanding) unless I got a deal too good to pass up. Given the many choices on and near the Mag mile, I'd prob try a different hotel in search of that Wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location.....with reservations.”
Reviews.Author: mpwineca
Reviews.Content: The price for a "suite" at this hotel is very reasonable. When I stayed there in August on a business trip it was chock full of vacationing families as good evidence that pricing and location were very attractive. But it is also a hotel that tries too hard to do too much. The rooms are all suites but only because a wall was put up to create two very small rooms. The bathroom was adequate but nothing special. The amenities were those you would expect from a chain hotel. There are better choices in the Chicago hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: iriskasiriskas
Reviews.Content: Helpful and nice staff, great location!! Would stay again, most definatelly!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pkdesign
Reviews.Content: Believe all the great reviews of this property. The service was impeccable. Everyone had a smile and a hello when you walked by. When my partner and I checked in I happen to mention that we were celebrating his 40th birthday and lo and behold, a wonderful piece of cake arrived at our door that night! Now THAT is attention to detail. Brianna actually took note of what I said and sent him the cake. At many hotels you are lucky they get your name right. We mentioned that we wanted the mini bar key so we could keep our own drinks cool and they immediately said the could send up a mini fridge which showed up at at room within an hour! We had the smallest of the suites at the end of the hallway and even that was very nice and perfectly fine for us. Very well appointed and comfortable. I could see however that rooms on the Michigan Avenue side of the hotel looking south faced the construction of a RItz Carlton next door. I would be VERY concerned about getting one of those rooms. I did not see any of the "worn" appearance some review speak about. I would agree that the hotel lacks any sort of grand entrance, Heck, it doesn't have any kind of special entrance. And having to take an elevator to the third floor, then get off and take another elevator to your floor was a bit annoying. It would be really nice if there were a nice entrance were you could lounge with fellow travelers, and people watch all the great people walking down Michigan Ave. All in all I would highly recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Hotel - What a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: boomerusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Hotel for 3 days with my wife for our 10 year Anniversary. I had booked about a month in advance and pid around 310 a night for a King 1 bedroom suite. I had preregistered the day before and my Key was waiting to be picked up in teh lobby- very easy and worth doing. I had requested a high floor and had noted that it was our anniversary. The room was perfect not huge but huge for the money- Seperate living room with TV. The only thing we did not love was the double doors off the bedroom into thebathroom. The staff was great. Concierge and the bellmen outfront were very helpful. The hotel also left a Chocolate anniversary cake for us our frist night. Used the gym- not huge but definetly good enough for a decent workout. There is a small indoor pool as well. Breakfast at the hotel was pretty good as well. Also there is Starbucks kiosk in the lobby in the morning. We booked the architectural boat tour through the hotel.- that was great and worth doing. The location of the hotel is great. Right off Michigan Ave. - near all the shopping and not far from anything. It took us about 25 minutes to get to Wrigley taxi even with gameday traffic. Chicago is an amazing town in the summer and we cna't wait to go back and stay at the omni.

Reviews.Title: “personal service in the windy city”
Reviews.Author: shephj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni hotel in Chicago for a well earned girls wk end. We were celebrating several special occasions. ALL the staff from check in to check out where at the top of their game. Every one went out of their way with each contact with us to make sure our stay was wonderful. I had the opportunity to recommend a hotel this wk and did not hesitate to suggest the Omni. The Omni was located walking distance from most of our destinations. The ones that needed a cab ride where made easy by the door men, who gave the drivers directions for us. My one tip would be to request a room in the front of the hotel, awesome city views. The side room windows face the side of another building.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! :-D”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterM
Reviews.Content: The location was great!!! We walked to mostly everything! (Make sure that you join the loyalty program for extra bonuses!) The room was very clean and spacious. The staff (bellmen, front desk, bar, housekeeping, and concierge) were all friendly and gracious. I would recommend this hotel and I will return! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: denajennell
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Omni Chicago! The staff was very friendly and you can't beat the location! Also, the rooms were clean, quiet and really comfortable. They do look a little tired as other have mentioned. I'm OK with it especially since I got such a good deal... if I would have paid the published rate, it would have been a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Farmboy18707
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at the corner of Michigan Avenue - close to the Water Tower, in the heart of the Magnificent Mile.Very safe neighborhood, easy walking distnace to many attractions. The queen suite was very spacious, as was the modern bathroom. Living room boasted a flat screen tv, a sofa, and a desk area. the bedroom had nightstands on both sides of the queen bed, and a built-in dresser under the tv. (Could have used more light to see in the drawers). My only complaint was the closet - I think this may have been a handicapped accessible room, which would excuse the low bar in the closet. We were here for a wedding, and a suit just cleared the floor - dresses were on the floor. The room was quiet and well appointed - good value for Chicago. Staff attentive and friendly, as was the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PatLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the service was great, and the bell/door staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to great us each time we entered and left the hotel....asking if they could be of assistance to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit tired though”
Reviews.Author: leiceterboy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location just off the magnificent mile (great if you like your shopping). Nice gym and pool. The rooms were very dated however. Peeling wallpaper and tired furniture. No free wi-fi either (9.95 a day!). Dark as well. For the price I think the Embassy Suites (Lakeshore) are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mitraveler1234
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel...it is our favorite place to stay. Pricey but worth it. Great location for shopping. Ask for the corner suite.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it's a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iamadaydreamer98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Love the location! Breakfast was nice at their restaurant. Rooms and hallways need an update... They are looking a bit outdated and tired. The valet service was quick and efficient. Overall nice hotel at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nicole987
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Omni Chicago and couldn't say enough good things about the hotel. The accommodations were excellent for my husband, 3 kids and I. We had plenty of space and do much storage room! The pool is small but kids loved it (I did too as it was very warm). The service was great, everyone was so nice and helpful and they do an excellent job of making the kids feel welcome. The location couldn't be better. I signed up for the loyalty program which has many benefits and I highly recommend it. We all really enjoyed our stay at the Omni and will definitely stay here again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!! Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on Michigan Ave! Hotel staff was very accommodating. We got there a couple hours before check-in time and they had a room available for us. They also held our bags for a few hours after we checked out since we had an evening flight. 676 Bar was great, bartender made very good drinks. We definitely enjoyed our stay and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - will stay here again when we return!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: We stay at Omni hotels when we travel with our two kids - ages 11 and 15. Went to Chicago for a weekend getaway prior to the start of school. The room we were checked into was not clean - food crumbs on the floor and hair on the bathroom floor. The carpet condition was terrible - tears, and badly worn. The vent cover on the wall was filthy and fell off onto the floor. My husband called and they immediately moved us to another room. All of the rooms are suites and very spacious. We had a king bed and a sofa bed for our kids which was ok. The suite we were moved into was the same, but seemed cleaner and the carpet was in better condition. We were so surprised at the condition of the carpet for an Omni! We know you pay for the location and it gets a lot of traffic, but it really is time for some updating. Anyways... The location, the staff, the bed, the plasma t.v.s, lounge/restaurant, and views all made up for it. Many more positives than negatives. We will stay there again when we go back. Chigago is beautiful and there is so much to see and do - we didn't have enough time! We were on our feet for two days straight shopping and sightseeing. We were exhausted. The kids never used the pool and I never used the fitness center. Slept extremely well in the very comfy king bed but next time will get a room with two doubles for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations; Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sadiejrt
Reviews.Content: We visit Chicago once or twice a year and try and stay in different hotels. The Omni's location is good for visitors wanting to see the city. The subway was only 3 blocks away and many restaurants and sights were within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived well before the 3pm check-in, but were given our room early. I requested a room with a view and wasn't disappointed. We opted for a suite which gave us some extra space to relax. The only thing missing were vending machines, but we found a convenience store nearby. Room was pricey, but worth the comfort and accessibility to city sights. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid. Recommended. End of story.”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoastfun
Reviews.Content: We were there for our anniversary and combining a weekend away with some business and were not disappointed. Clean room, nice flatscreen and HBO. The room was a bit drab, not lux, but nice enough. They were great at customer service, however. They sent us a piece of cake to celebrate our anniversary, which was thoughtful. Super nice at check-in, great follow through when requesting extras from housekeeping. Timely room service and attentive conceriege. Overall, solid and well run. Would not hesitate to stay again. That being said, if you like a jetted tub or soaking bath, there are none! Only one in whole hotel in Presidential suite-- we tried to upgrade but it was not available entire stay. If only! Otherwise, almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ExclamationMark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove to Chicago with our dog and stayed at the Omni. From the moment we pulled up in our car until we left, we were almost overwhelmed by the positive welcoming attitude of the staff. The property is in great shape and it was nice to stay in an all suite hotel so well located on Michigan Avenue. You can tell that management has really focused on employee attitudes and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nurat Q
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Omni Hotels; however this one in Chicago is located in one the best city in the world. The staff are amazing,the location of the hotel is in the heart of the Magnificent Miles. I am out till midnight just to take all the vicinities in. Love, love it! Always leave early for airports because traffic is terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Michigan Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: OpenSky
Reviews.Content: We liked the suites at the Omni. The bedroom was separated by a door that closed. The living area had a pull out couch. The room also came with a mini frig. The kids had a great time at the pool. And there is an outdoor deck right off the pool which was very nice at night. We ate dinner at Restaurant 676, nice decor and convenient to have a restaruant at the hotel. The pork chop dinner was excellent. We also ate there for breakfast and it was very good. Great location to all the Michigan Ave activities! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids - service excellent - beds just ok”
Reviews.Author: JakeCincy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for three night with our two sons (4 yrs and and infant). The room was clean although a bit small once the pullout couch was out and everyone was asleep. The baby crib was old and didn't look comfortable. Definitely bring your own pack n play. The employees were so nice and this hotel really caters to kids. Great location. Beds are just ok and would go for two rooms next time to have extra room, but overall a good value and close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Very kid friendly...we had a great time here”
Reviews.Author: jstevenson0617
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night with our 6 and 4 year old girls. Having lived in Chicago for 15 years, we wanted a hotel close to Michigan Ave and Near North for our kids, knowing they would love this area. The Omni's location really was perfect...Water Tower, Hancock, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, great food, museums, shopping, river, loop, etc. all located within walking distance. Upon checking in, the kids were given these cute little backpacks filled with activities and treats. They thought this was great and wore them for the next 2 days. At the check-in desk, I asked about a room with a view. There wasn't one ready (and I didn't pay for one) but the clerk said it would be about an hour if I wanted to wait. He took my cell phone number to call me when it was ready. So we stored our luggage and walked down to Navy Pier for a boatride. Sure enough, within about 55 min the hotel called to let me know we could check in. The room was quite spacious for a downtown, city hotel room. A small living area with a sofa and tv, desk and bar area made up the first part. Through a set of double doors was a bedroom, also a decent size, with two double beds. The bathroom was nice as well and the closet had a lot of room. Went down to the pool, which was a bit of a dissapointment. It is a little small, but being a city hotel I can understand that. The three main issues I had were: 1) the temperature of the pool area was freezing! Everyone in there (I'd say 12-15 adults/kids) were either in the pool, which was warmer than the air, or wrapped up in the pool towels for warmth. It was very uncomfortable and not enjoyable at all. 2) the hot tub wasn't on and wasn't filled. Considerng the temp of the air, this was even a bigger disappointment. At least 6 people came down to use the hot tub while we were there, only to be disappointed by its emptiness. 3) the pook deck itself is made of tile and is incredibly slippery when wet. Why in the world this kind of tile was chosen for the pool area is beyond me. Three people, including myself, almost wiped out. I was really worried the kids would fall and hit their heads. It really was poorly designed. When we got back from dinner, housekeeping had turned down our bed, replaced all of our towels (which we had used when we got back from the pool) and left milk and cookies. The kids were so thrilled with this little gesture. The last thing I'll report about is leaving something in our room. Unfortunately, after we checked out and were driving out of the city, we realized that our 4 year old's favorite stuffed animal had been left in the room. I called the hotel and was connected with Chris in security. He took my name and number and promised to call me back after looking for the stuffed animal. Within 10 minutes he had found the bunny, called me back and offered to FedEx it, on Omni's dime, to our home. It arrived today. I was very impressed with the Omni and will definitely return on our next visit. The service was excellent and their treatment of the young kids was really refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: willi348
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The suites are very nice and it was great to have the extra space during our 4-night stay. The hotel is in a great location and you can walk to so many things. They had a really great promotional rate for the room and I would stay there again.
