The one big annoyance that we had was with the elevators in this hotel. You have to take one elevator up to the lobby and then go to another bank of elevators to take a different one up to your room. It just felt like we spent quite a bit of time waiting around for elevators due to this and there was no way around it. Other than that this hotel is really great and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Omni”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this location and it was Fantastic. We did a quick getaway for my birthday. The front desk greeted us and wished me a happy birthday. When we got back from diner I was greeted with a delicious slice of chocolate cake. We were also upgraded to a larger room with two different street views. We could see the people on the roof top swimming pools around the area. It was also a very quiet room we didn't even notice that we were in the heart of the shopping district and near a hospital. The Omni is the best and worth every penny if you want quality service. I only wish they had more locations across the country because it is a step down when you compare other hotel chains to the Omni experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: knitgrl
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in Chicago. Love the all-suite aspect, staff is always friendly and helpful and this time my deal included vouchers for food. Had a great dinner at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Will Return”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromDaBronx
Reviews.Content: Stay there because I received a good deal through Southwest Airlines, Hotel is in the middle of the "Miracle Mile" on Michigan Avenue, and conveniently located. Room was quiet. Furnishings in the room were very good. Will stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HOTEL AND THE STAFF WAS AMAZING.”
Reviews.Author: CantonDude
Reviews.Content: I searched hi and low for various deals and packages with respect to location. We wanted something close to American Girl Doll Store, The Cheesecake factory, and Chiradelli and the Hershey's store. The Omni hotel had a few great packages and was a few blocks away from all of our requirements. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by the doorman and the bell hop and within seconds our van was unloaded and we were inside the lower level. The car was taken to valet for $52 a day. In the lower lobby they offered 3 different refreshments - lemonade, water and strawberry mint water. They also offered us umbrellas as needed and bottled water for each of us upon departure. We ascended the elevator to floor 3 and checked into the room in under 1 minute. We were assigned room 1107 and it was 2 double bed in a separate room and a pull out couch for the girls. There was 1 bathroom with a bar and sink. The room was clean and spacious. Hotel Packages..We had 2 girls and so we booked a one night American Girl Doll package for 2. It included their own American girl doll bed with bedding and changes of clothes as well at turndown they received 2 cookies and a carton of milk and a tray of assorted pink/red chewy candy like licorice and gummy bears etc. The girls felt like Queens. The other 2 nights we took the $50 restaurant coupon for $100.00 in all. Now for the rest of the hotel. In order to get to our hotel room from the street you had to take 2 different elevators - no real big deal. The concierge was absolutely wonderful and extremely helpful. The pool was the biggest let down as it seemed like an afterthought. The hot tub was not working either. The fitness center was well equiped and everything seemed to be functional. Our only issue was in the restuarnt where my wife had an overcooked steak and sent it back. It took 35 min to get it sent out again and by that time we were all done and the kids basically had it for the night. Her dinner was free that night. The restaurant was also very nicely decorated and was very nice to sit in during the night time hours. I would have rated this hotel a 5star if the my wifes dinner was cooked properly and if the pool had been updated. I feel that the staff were very attentive to our needs and we would stay there again. Of note we did have breakfast on the side of the street at the hotel and it was very good....

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Marmar22
Reviews.Content: We did a quick trip to Chicago recently and had a great time . The Omni was terrific, a very clean and spacious one bedroom suite with a pullout couch allowed us to get one room, even though traveling with our young adult daughters. The service and food was good and the area was unbeatable. We will return here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: quicktravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and will go back again. Become a preferred select member and get free internet! The front desk was always willing to help particularly as I had to complete a business transaction.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 Star Value”
Reviews.Author: bonniede
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby and elevators are rather odd, I like this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in a King suite. The suite was large, clean, well laid out, and well equipped. The bed was great, and all linens clean and good quality. The bathroom was large with good counter space, lights and mirrors, and plenty of hot water. There was a flat screen tv in the livingroom, and a smaller older tv in the separate bedroom. The view was fine from our room on the 15th floor. I found it very quiet. As other reviewers have said the hotel location is great. We didn't try their dining room or bar because we wanted to explore Chicago. There are so many great restaurants within walking distance! I highly recommend joining the membership as it provides free internet, and coffee and newspapers delivered to your door. This service was a little inconsistent, but overall I was quite satisfied. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting 4 star quality, a great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomofone
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago with my mom and 10 yr old son for 2 days. Arrived at 10:30 am chicago time. We were told we could have a room now on oneside or wait for the otherside, none of them faced Michigan ave. Took the one that was ready. In minutes we were in our room with luggage following us up. The room was clean and well done. The room was VERY dark, there was a building very close blocking ANY view and ANY sunlight. I called the desk and was told ALL rooms are blocked from sun there because of surrounding buildings. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our tv did not work properly so Joe from maintainance came up a few times, he even stayed passed quitting time,missing his train home to change the set when he could not fix it. The breakfast buffet was expensive but good. Overall the staff made the hotel, just disappointed on the lighting and lack of view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: PatGreenvilleNC
Reviews.Content: The Omni in Chicago was the perfect location for a 1st time visitor to the city! The rooms were very clean and we stayed in a suite which was very quite even though it was right on Michigan Ave! The bellmen were just top-notch! They were very helpful with directions, cabs, reccomendations for restaurants, etc. We especially liked the breakfast buffet at the Omni....the food was superb! We did the breakfast and room special and it was well worth it! Just out the doors of the hotel you stepped right out on the shopping district and could pretty much walk everywhere. We did enjoy staying here and will stay again if we visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: BigDontour
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally situated for our three night sightseeing visit to Chicago. There is a bus stop closeby for one of the hop on hop off bus tours which we found perfect for getting to the sights we wished to visit, it was a $10 taxi ride to Navy Pier, an easy walk to DuSAble Bridge where we picked up a river and harbour cruise. There are a number of restaurants roundabout including Gino's East, the best Chicago pizza in town. We were in our rooms with luggage within minutes of arrival , our party consisted of six people, having been welcomed by porters and efficient receptionist. The room was clean and comfortable and there was a pleasant bar for a nightcap to end the day after a busy day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveldp
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, well kept property in the heart of Michigan Avenue. It is located within an easy walking distance to popular attractions, the train and the lake. The room was a suite style, very attractive, clean and comfortable. The brunch was excellent but on the pricey side. There are several garages within 1-2 blocks that offered less expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Cullercoats
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, and from start to finish couldn't fault the room, service or food at this hotel. Loved the fact it was a suite rather than a normal hotel room & also the location was perfect for everything we wanted to see & do. Signed up for their select guest profile which gave us free internet, bottled water when we arrived & fresh beverages delivered to our room each morning (this was a lovely extra). We'd asked for a quiet room and we got exactly what we'd asked for. Will stay again if ever in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Omni in the Windy City!”
Reviews.Author: srcaOntario
Reviews.Content: Requested an early check in at the Omni since our flight arrived early on Saturday morning and we were tired. Weren't sure if they would be able to accommodate this request but thought it was worth a try. They weren't able to get us a room right away, but asked for my cell phone number and stored our baggage until a room was available. About an hour after we left the hotel, they called my cell phone to say our room was ready. Appreciated the early check in. Pretty good location - right on the Magnificent Mile and a few blocks from the river. Not much of a shopper so in retrospect would have preferred a hotel overlooking the river. Stayed on the 18th floor overlooking Michigan Ave so no complaints. We had tickets to see a Chicago White Sox game and were planning on taking a cab. The girls working at the front desk on Saturday night (the game was on Sunday) told us to just take the subway since it is only $2.50/person and easy to do. They showed us how to take the subway and we did - very easy and cheap, cheap, cheap. Beds are comfortable and rooms are clean. House keeper comes one in the morning and once in the evening for turn down service. Overall a nice hotel and a great time in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “We had a GREAT STAY, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Nwash
Reviews.Content: Join their select guest program, the benefits are real and significant unlike a lot of other places. Search and work for good rates. Omni's prices are always going up and down. I get the best luck when I call the hotel directly. The website and toll free number are unyielding. Great hotel, clean rooms, excellent location, great staff -very friendly, free room service coffee every morning for select guests. Restaurant and bar are way over priced and I don't like the starbucks coffee they serve every day but I can overlook this. I love starbucks and their specialty drinks but their ordinary coffee has always tasted a bit skunky to me. Also the sliding doors for the bathrooms can't be locked. If I weren't staying alone or shared a room on a business trip this would be awful. Another side note, the Pool area was cold and Hot tub wasn't filled. I usually don't have time to swim in Chicago but it's worth mentioning. Thanks to Chicago's crappy zoning regulations, one thing that's really a shame and will change Omni forever is the Ritz-Carlton. Ritz-Carlton is building a massive hotel just to the South of Omni. I mean there may be 6 inches if that between these hotels and the Ritz extends just a about 4 feet closer to Michigan completely ruining the South view and corner room views Omni had on Michigan. What were once top rate, top price rooms, are now the worst rooms in the hotel. What a bummer. Omni can't be happy. Still a great hotel that can be had a fair prices. Thanks to the Ritz maybe even better prices. I had a lot of fun, Thanks OMNI!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the service and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: AnOnym0us3410
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel went above and beyond expectations. We were always greeted in a friendly manner, bellhops went out of their way to find us van cabs (we had a group of 5 so it wasn't always easy to find transportation), and the turn down service in the evening was a welcome amenity. If you sign up for the Omni Select Loyalty Program you get free Wi-Fi in the room, otherwise there is a charge for this service. You also get complimentary morning beverage service and on-line check-in service that ensures your room is ready when you arrive! Since it's a free program, it's well worth signing up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, will definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on North Michigan Ave right in the centre of Chicago - only about 4 doors away from Tiffany's (heaven)!! Service was excellent, nothing was too much trouble. The bar area is very relaxing and the choice of wines good to just chill out after a hard day shopping! Hotel is near to the subway/overground metro service and a short taxi away to Union Station to get to the outlet malls. They looked after our bags on the last day with no charge too which was excellent. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious, great service”
Reviews.Author: sb1099
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2001 which was nice. The location is very convenient to Michigan ave shopping and restaurants. 5* for spaciousness, 5* for the small but adequate heated pool, 5* for the small but adequate fitness center, 5* for the surprisingly good room service food, 6* for the service. 3* for dated decor, with all the other things going for it the Omni deserves an update. At least buy some fluffy new pillows guys - I'd be willing to pay more for the room!

Reviews.Title: “Most unaccommodating hotel in Chicago, don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: teporama
Reviews.Content: A family friend came to stay at the hotel and had some friends in the room prior to leaving for a concert. At 8pm there were complaints that they were talking too loud and security went to the room. They were told to keep it down. "Multiple other complaints" came in (heresay) and the young man was ejected from the hotel. Despite his having paid $333 for 2 nights through Priceline, he was not afforded any refund nor was given any alternative. I contacted the hotel and asked repeatedly for reconsideration for this evening's stay in which he would be alone and was told absolutely not. Not an ounce of compassion for a young man who spent hard earned money to stay here. Unbelievable attitudes from all staff members, condescending, rude and totally inconsiderate of the situation. Unless you are planning to only sleep here, not TALK, don't bother, you'll probably get thrown out.

Reviews.Title: “room 2305 excellent: room 504 not!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chemainus48
Reviews.Content: Very good location. First room wasextremely depressing because you looked directly out onto a deck of some sort covered in garbage and cigarette butts (there was no excuse for this as there was a door acessing this area, so it could easily have been cleaned up.) Room 504 was as dark in the dayime, as it was in the middle of the night! I called the desk immediately, but was told that we could not be moved until the next day (this did not make a lot of sense as it was not a last minute reservation (was booked in December 2010) and it was not a late arrival - plenty of check-ins after us). After a call and visit to the desk the following moning we were moved to a much nicer location ( with a wonderful view) on the 23rd floor. Everything else about the hotel was lovely, what you would expect from an above average "big city" hotel. Conciege, front door, bell, and housekeeping staff were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Well... Oprah sends her guests there”
Reviews.Author: DJqc
Reviews.Content: This is Oprah's hotel of choice when hosting guests in Chicago. So obviously it must be good enough for phlebs like us. What i like about this place is that unlike most hotels, the average room is actually quite nice. Whereas as most other hotels require an upgrade before it gets nice. The beds are oh so comfy. Now here is my little tip to you if you want to get a room here at a steal. Hotwire has this place for very cheap... around $120. However, for those of you who don't know , hotwire requires that you book without knowing the name of the hotel you are booking. In exchange you get an incredible deal. The only details they give is the approximate location and features. Now the secret.... There is a site called better bidding that will help you figure out what hotels you are actually looking at on hotwire. By this way you can get an incredible on hotels such as the omni, the drake, and other high end places. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location!!”
Reviews.Author: crazygirl37
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel...I have stayed here several times and every time we come its great!!It was our anniversary and the hotel knew so the one evening when we came back to the hotel room, there was a cake with writing on it wishing us happy anniversary. A wonderful suprise.!!If I could I would stay here everytime but sometimes rates do get to high pending on whats going on in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Up Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARLVAGUY
Reviews.Content: The good parts: A great location right on the Mag Mile...but not close enough to an "L" stop to be truly convenient to public transportation; One of the nicest beds I've slept in...but the slippery comforter kept sliding off so I had to flip it over to the fuzzier side. Great toiletries. The bad parts: Costly and slow internet; broken A/C in the workout room (but otherwise a really well-equipped room with high-grade headphones and lemon-infused ice water...no one seemed to care that the workout room was 85 degrees either); a Ritz-Carlton going up next door that blocks views (Howdy Neighbor!); housekeeping kept insisting on cleaning my room two hours after I checked in (never knew I was that much of a slob).

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at three hotels and this was my favorite!!!”
Reviews.Author: parkmusic42
Reviews.Content: What a great stay at the OMNI. The only hotel I stayed at that had free wifi, large rooms, and a great hot tub. The service at the front desk was impeccable and even switched my room to a double bed suite when I found out a colleague was going to be staying with me. (At no charge). You have a customer for life. I will be staying at the OMNI in Dallas next

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelwhenwecan5960
Reviews.Content: The Omni Chicago has one of the best location for seeing Chicago. Right on Michigan and we were able to walk to Rush St. restaurants as well as down to millennium park for some great sight seeing. The staff and service of the Omni was outstanding in every area. The beds were great for a good night sleep and the bathroom was very nice. The only minor concern was some of the sitting area furniture was a little worn but still fine and very functional. The Omni's breakfast buffet was outstanding and a must if you in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Gave it a second chance and glad we did”
Reviews.Author: maisypie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni several years ago and did not care for it at all. Upon arrival, we found a used condom on the floor - beyond disgusting! The hotel management moved us, but it definitely made us wonder about the cleanliness of the rooms. Fast forward several years, and I decide to take my daughter to Chicago for a quick weekend shopping spree. I got a fantastic rate at the Omni from an online travel site and decided to give it another try. This trip, the Omni was great. The location can't be beat, and our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. I was hesitant to stay there after our first experience, but after this positive experience I will even recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: mariahbay
Reviews.Content: Great location with well trained, personable staff and quick response to needs. 676 Restaurant is good value for $$ with great view of Michigan Ave. Rooms are reasonably soundproof, but if you want to avoid the fire truck, ambulance or the street saxophonist that really likes Huron and Rush (our corner), get a room in the back. Do sign up for the Omni Select Guest Program.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChambanaTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a weekend getaway to Chicago or Indy. When we found rates at the Omni Hotel for just over half price, we decided on Chicago. The hotel was very nice, quiet, and clean. I was a little disappointed that the only refrigerator in our suite was the minibar, but that's not a make or break deal for me. The location was great...right in the middle of shopping and restaurants. We ordered a late night dessert from room service/676 restaurant, since the crummy weather convinced us to stay in after dinner that night. It arrived quickly and everything was quite good. I only have two minor complaints. One...the toilet in our room ran the entire time we were there. We closed the door to the bathroom and so it didn't bother us much. Two...I was suprised that we had to seek out a valet when we arrived rather than having one come out to our car. After our arrival the valets were always quite friendly and helpful, but our inital impression was less than positive.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: isabella051
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni last July first visit to Chicago. Well impressed with the city as well as the hotel. So much we did not see enough and have booked to return this July again. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “One Fantastic Place with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: MissBlue2
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This Omni Hotel is located with in walking distance to shopping, restaurants. The rooms are wonderful, you have a small sitting area with a bar, coffee pot, sink, a desk and two comfortable chairs to watch T.V., then you have a separate bedroom with it's own T.V. the windows are "clean"and they open up for a little fresh air. Talk to the doorman, they have a lot of knowledge to share and are most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Location and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: nonfiction_diction
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first 3 night stay in Chicago. From O'Hare we took the blue line subway to Clark/Lake and it was a $10 cab ride. To O'Hare on a Sunday we took a cab direct for $45. Excellent location. 5 minute walk from the Water Tower Mall, John Hancock Tower, Pizzaria Uno and other essential locations. 15-20 minute walk to the Navy Pier, Millenium Park or Portillo's. $10-$15 cab ride south to the Shedd Aquarium/Field Museum. $8 cab ride north to places like Hugo's/Gibson's in the Gold Coast region. The staff were all polite and helpful. The hallways/rooms are tired (NY Omni was significantly better) but not a deal breaker. The worst aspect of our stay was the bed. The mattress was capital "S" soft and had definitely seen better days. It is the only reason I did not rate the hotel as "excellent". However because of the staff and location I would return to this Omni and defintitely recommend for you if you are planning a shopping or sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but tired”
Reviews.Author: JohnL10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for seeing Chicago and you can walk to many places easily. There are good restaurants, bars, bistro's around the hotel. The staff were without exception helpful, polite, and genuinly wanted to help. They were useful with information and tips on where to go. Suites are nice with comfortable beds and good showers, but I must admit I felt they were a bit tired and dated. Beige carpets, beige bed covers, beige wall coverings, and beige bathrooms. It's time Omni did an update of the rooms and corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: KFM9275
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect, and the rooms are fabulous. We stopped here for one night on our way home from Dublin. It was well worth recovering from jet lag in such comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaleyJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 9 nights from the 14th of April. The hotel is lovely, Staff are friendly and attentive and the front desk are very efficient. The rooms were very comfortable and loved the 2 tv's. The hotel is walking distance from Millenium Park, Art institute, Navy Pier, shopping and more. It as a brilliant stay and we will definitely stay there again if we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: msn58
Reviews.Content: Omni typically has nicer than average hotels and this is no exception. With a great location right on Michigan Ave, the all-suite property is upscale yet accessible. Staff are well-trained and service oriented. I did not experience any problems during my stay. My room on the 19th floor had nice south views of the city; the condo construction next door did not interfere with the view but I was almost to the other corner. The room was laid out comfortably and was very quiet, at the end of the hall. Wireless internet access was sketchy in the living/office area of the room however, with signal strength improving only in the bedroom. Note that if you sign up for the loyalty program, internet is free and you also get complimentary beverages delivered to your door each morning, a very nice touch. I had two meals in the restaurant, which is expensive but typical for downtown Chicago (esp on Mich Ave). The breakfast buffet at $20 includes many choices, food was well prepared, and you get to look out over Michigan Avenue. Valet parking is the only option and be prepared to wait 10-15 minutes to retrieve your vehicle since the garage they use is two blocks away. Valet staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful; I was even provided a complimentary bottle of water while I waited. There is a roomy fitness facility with changing area and single shower, but no spa-type services. In short, this was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in in Chicago and would definitely return, esp when promotional pricing is offered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great fitness center, obliterated view”
Reviews.Author: amysue01
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful (front desk, bell staff, doormen, housekeeping), the fitness center was very clean and up to date, the pool and hot tub are tiny and at peak times PACKED with kids. When my boys went down closer to closing time, all the little ones had gone to bed and they enjoyed the pool. The location on Michigan Avenue is perfect. Unfortunately, the neighboring building is expanding upward about 20 feet (maybe less) from your windows on the south side of the building. So, if view is not important to you, this remains a fantastic hotel. If seeing a concrete wall right out your window is disconcerting, either make sure you reserve a room type that faces Michigan Avenue or consider other options.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Scored a Home Run”
Reviews.Author: garypcsc
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with our 4 day stay at the Omni. We've stayed at other Omni properties, but didn't select them because they were an Omni, just because it was the best deal for the best place at the time. I'll now start looking for Omni's first. We had booked reservations at another hotel when a very good deal appeared on TravelZoo which included Valet Parking and $25.00 per day food or beverage credit (turned out to be $27 per day). In addition Select Guest members (Omni's loyalty membership club) get their choice of 2 beverages delivered to their room daily, plus free internet which costs other guests about $11.00. In my estimation, this makes The Select Guest membership program one of the best around. I can just see the reaction I'd get at Hilton or Marriott if I asked for free internet or daily beverage service. Incidentally, I'm a long time member of both those guest programs. Now for the hotel itself. I've read other reviews which indicate that the guest rooms need updating, they were concerned with coffee tables in the room, the tub was too small etc . In my opinion, the suite was perfectly layed out with room for flat screen TV, a fairly large desk and 2 easy chairs, plus a sink with mini-bar. A seperate bath with tub/shower combination and a seperate bedroom with closet and another TV. Incidentally, in our room the coffee table had been removed, but a seperate upholstered ottoman remains.. Would it be a great room for a family with kids, I don't know, but how many of them really are? We ate lunch at the 676 restaurant. Food was pretty good, but the descriptions of the entrees on the menu made me chuckle. I mean "Phil's cage free eggs" and Caesar Salad with spiced nature source farm beef tip or on the breakfast menu humanely raised bacon. Some of you may be snickering at me, but I get off on overly pretentious descriptions which try to justify really outrageous prices ie. $15 for a burger. I forgot to mention that the Select Guest membership also gets you nightly turndown service which we didn't use because the turn-down lady said that it didn't inclu de a piece of chocalate on your pillow. Finally, as mentioned by numerous other reviewers, the property is located smack dab in the middle of the Miracle Mile close to just about everything including public transportation. The valet was a little slow (ie.)15-20 minutes, the personnel very friendly and accommodating. Room service was also great. You can't go wrong by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: ZwennK
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Chicago for many years, I come back here quite frequently and usually try different hotels with good reviews. The Omni definitely is among the best places I've stayed so far. Fantastic service, great staff. Rooms are top - good layout, all amenities (and then some), and spotlessly clean! The rooms facing Huron might be a bit louder (sirens, traffic), but are preferable for their views (I'd avoid the other side facing south, there is a new construction going up) Michigan Ave is just steps away, and the full Near North entertainment is all within walking distance. Definitely recommended for shopping trips and a fabulous weekend in the best city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: zulu26
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to chicago and staying at the omni chicago was thoroughly worth it.The hotel is situated right in the middle of michigan avenue and easy walking distance to pretty much everywhere and boy did we walk everywhere! The hotel is spotlessly clean as was the room and the reception staff were very polite and accommodating,we asked for a room high up with views and was given one with no problems and requested a small fridge and one was delivered to the room in under 10 mins.The concierge was extremely helpful and the bar/restaurant was first class so all in all the omni gave us a great base to have a wonderful time exploring chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Omni was a great place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Xelint
Reviews.Content: We went up to Chicago and had a great deal on Priceline with made the Omni the choice for our first stay was we usually stay at Conrad or Westin. The service at the Omni was first rate from the valet to the check in. Prices for the valet was much higher than other properties but the valet service was also much better and always fully staffed. Chek in was very smooth and they made my dauther's day with the kids backpack (to keep) and game bag (they lend for the stay) I had decided that I wanted a different room than what I had reserved and there was no hassle in switching. The rooms are nice but not on the level of other 4 star hotles with the bedding and lines being a little below par. As others mentioned sign up for the Omni Select club as the turn down and free monring drinks are awesome. I did encounter a problem as I booked through priceline as my select number kept getting bumped out of the system but was always taken care of quickly and the wifi charge had already been removed from my bill before I checked on it. The restaurant 676 was very good for lunch and the food was very fresh. Ran into a problem with servive (which was not the waiters fault) as a huge group decided to split their bill after they had finished and half the group had left. The manager took care of me and took 25% off as an apology which was a classy move. The fitness club was first rate with plenty of equipment and prebagged headphones to use. The pool and hot tub are on the small side and with it beeing spring break was packed with people turning away due to the crowd size but probably not a problem other times of the year. Overall the service made the hotel and will definitely return for family trips to Chicago. If it was a couples trip probably will choose another option with more upscale rooms and bedding but definetly cannot go wrong with this hotel Thanks for the great time Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxiously Condescending Customer Service - Or Lack Thereof”
Reviews.Author: PenelopeCarr
Reviews.Content: My family booked five nitghts at the Omni Chicago for our upcoming spring break. We took advantage of a pre-paid, non-cancellable offer. We subsequently received a "Bed & Breakfast" offer via email and immediately called the hotel to inquire whether we could switch our reservation (same dates, different offer). We called the 800' number and the customer services representative was so obnoxiously condescending and ignorant, we simply hung up. We had been looking forward to our vacation, but now I am not sure I made the right choice with this hotel. I should have paid closer attention to the reviews - the Ritz, the Four Seasons, and the Peninsula would have never treated us this way. I will post again after our stay on April 17th.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: runtoeat
Reviews.Content: I like Omni and this property did not disappoint. Typical great Omni Staff and the location was perfect if you want to be on the MM. The restaurant is above average for a hotel restaurant in fact I would recommend it as place to dine while in Chicago. Sirens were noisy but that was not Omni's fault. We will stay here again. Good fitness center also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Michigan Ave. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dr_foucault
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a great hotel located on Michigan Avenue. It is located near many great places to shop. Everyone at the Omni is friendly and helpful. If you are a select guest the added perks are well appreciated. Every request we had was accommodated. Omni in Chicago is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would be very likely to visit another Omni location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in every aspect !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edhorowicz
Reviews.Content: My wife, 7 year old step-son and I just returned from a fantastic week in Chicago, staying at the Omni. Before we left I signed up for the Omni rewards scheme (it's free) as recommended. This ensures free wifi, complimentary morning drinks and newspaper of your choice and lots of other stuff. We were greeted on our arrival before the lobby area by friendly staff who promptly offered our 7 year old a kids activity pack and took us to the 3rd floor reception. We were given a room that was not what we had booked as we requested the separate lounge area. After a quick call to the reception we had our room changed. This was done with a polite, apologetic and friendly manor. The new room was fantastic and very large (rm1815). Our stay was so comfortable. The fitness centre and pool were fantastic, the pool making a 7 year old very happy. We ate at the hotel in the restaurant which was so delicious. Truffle popcorn a must. The cocktail lounge had no problem with children either. Overall a great location for seeing the best of this wonderful city, the staff friendly in particular the concierge guy, service great, cleanliness was second to none and worthy of five stars for sure! Really made our holiday the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: akehl29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so comfortable, the beds were very nice. We also had really great room service- we had a package that gave us a 50.00 meal credit every day and the food was really good. The location was perfect for shopping, just walk outside and you're in the middle of wonderful shopping in Chicago! I stayed with my little cousin and we had an American Girl package for her birthday, the staff was very nice and even gave her a bed for her doll.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Pool, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: MaeFlower05
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I woke in the morning wanting to go swimming. When we arrived at the pool the water was covered by a white scum. I then attempted to use both of the phones at the pool, one white phone and one emergency red phone, to call the desk. Both were out of service!!!! I am glad there wasn't an emergency. As we were exited the pool area I ran into a hotel employee and told her about the problems and then asked her to call us when the pool was clean.... never heard back. One more thing, in our room the furniture was mostly child friendly except for a large metal and glass outdated coffee table. Within 30 minutes my 5 year old fell and hit her mouth and began bleeding. They need to update this piece of furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some negatives”
Reviews.Author: SINN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one their Superior Cornet Suites with King bed. Our two daughters slept on the pullout sofa in the "living room". The rooms are not spacious, but good for a city hotel. Good: Great location, nice bar, good facilities (pool, jacuzzi, gym), separate room and tv for the kids, good lobby atmosphere. Bad: i) poor sound insulation: the kids were kept up by two women next door discussing their hangover and adventures. ii) construction right next to south side of the building: some noise and the view is now completely blocked. The hotel occupies the lower half of the building and there is now a new building being build right next to it on the south side, so don't expect advertised city views.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the "Suites"”
Reviews.Author: SojoCleveland
Reviews.Content: Beware those traveling with your children who think you will have a seperate living space when the kids are asleep in the "other room." All of the pictures online indicated a seperate sleeping area with a door. We specifically chose the Omni for this feature so that my friend and I could be in another room while our young daughters slept. There is a seperate sleeping area, but our room had no door, despite specifically requesting one. When we called to ask for a room change, another room was not available to us. Also, we asked for cribs and a refrigerator to be in the room and even called ahead of time to verify the requests we had through our online booking. Despite our efforts, the cribs and a refrigerator still were not in the room when we arrived. Housekeeping quickly did bring them to the room, but while we had planned ahead, the hotel had not. We will not be returning to the Omni Chicago with our young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cabas10
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a nice hotel with absolutely the best location.....walk about the front door and step into a wonderland of shopping on Michigan Avenue. I felt the price at $500 was rather high considering there was no jacuzzi in the room but would I do it again? If my mission was shopping? Probably.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted it to be special”
Reviews.Author: HeidiNewYork
Reviews.Content: I booked a special weekend,treating my sister and niece to fun in Chicago. I got premo tickets to The Lion King, dinner at The Grand Lux,and I thought one of the best hotels in Chicago. I was dissapointed in the unfriendly check -in.Once up to the suite I found it dusty and dirty..I thought it happens..o.k. But once we were all dressed up to go to the play,we waited out front for help getting a cab..nobody helped,they were all talking in a circle too busy to notice 3 ladies needing a cab.We hailed our own. Nobody greeted us comming or going from the hotel.something I am really used to when staying at the Sheraton Four Points on Rush Street. To sum it up..The Omni is a 4 star Hotel that acts like a 2 star. The Sheraton Four Points is a 2 or 3 star that acts like a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family New Years Eve Getaway”
Reviews.Author: drbunroe
Reviews.Content: Omni was a great location, comfortable stay for our family of five with 3 teenagers on a restaurant/shopping 3 day binge. Provided for a great "base of operations" for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around!”
Reviews.Author: AJR2000
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Omni and it was a great experience. First of all the location can't be beat! Since it is an all suite hotel the rooms are very spacious. Be sure to join the Omni loyalty program and you get extra perks (beverages delivered to your room in the morning). They are also very great with kids. They provided a fun pack for our son before we even got to the front desk, and each night brought cookies and milk.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster, in every way”
Reviews.Author: losangelesjeremy
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on New Years Weekend and was given a tiny "studio suite" - the rationale being that I had asked for a king bed on my profile. The idea that a "studio suite," i.e. a regular room exists at an "all suites" hotel is baffling. In fact, the idea of a "studio suite" itself is entirely counterintuitive. And the thought that the front desk would give that terrible room to a loyalty member who had a wedding and brought 50 people to an omni property less than 6 month ago is absurd. I trudged back to the front desk after seeing this terrible room and asked for an actual suite - and was given a beat up, dirty, crappy room. Maybe that is how all the rooms are but it was not for me. We had booked using credit card points and since it wasn't costing us out of pocket, we almost just left. I wish we would have. The hote was the height of mediocirty. The staff was rude - I asked for new pillows and got a lecture on how there should be some in a musty bag in my closet. There were, they were feather and I had already checked. I was so disapointed that I had to take a walk late that first night. The only bright spot were the guys at the front door - we asked for directions and they were friendly and we needed cabs and they hailed them. Nothing special or personal but not incompetent like the rest of the hotel. Little victories. Maybe if i was in chicago on business and i had meetings from early morning until late at night, staying here wouldn't be the most depressing thing in the world. but coming for pleasure, stay anywhere but here. I wish we would have check out - it was the most "unspecial" lackluster stay at a hotel I have ever had. No personality, no charm, no personal service. Just blah. An aging, sagging, boring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: awm414
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and location. Service very good and if you are a premiere guest member, lots of added bennies. Breakfast was excellent. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location for Holidays!”
Reviews.Author: Judy_Ann
Reviews.Content: Location is fabulous. I would suggest not accepting a room with even numbers. I had reserved 3 rooms, all had even numbers, and all had noise from construction in a building next door. The view from one window per room was a view into the building. My Premier King had a terrible odor, a broken bathroom door, and unsightly cracked bathroom tile. By my request, I was moved to another floor to a room with an uneven number and all was great. Room 1117 was clean, large, and had great views. Street noise was minimal. Promotional price was outstanding. We had vouchers for food/beverages and used them in the 4th floor lounge. The lounge was perfect for the holidays, with a modern feeling to it and an extremely nice bartender. The hotel rooms were looking a bit 'tired' and some renovation will be needed. All in all, we had a wonderful experience. Jewel and Christy at the front desk in the day.....Thank you. Front desk gal in the p.m.....never smiled nor offered an apology for the inconvenience of my room change.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingfool1900
Reviews.Content: Purchased the mocha package. Check-in was smooth with the front desk person telling me about and showing me the bonus of my package yet forgetting to put it in my room key sleeve. Went back down to the front desk and the original person was gone. The next person seemed put out that I was requesting my perk, almost seeming to disbelieve me. However, I did get it. Room is of average quality. Bed sheet had blood on it as did one of the towels in the bathroom. Seemed like the maid had a cut on her finger when she made up the room. Room was on the opposite side of construction and not on Michigan avenue. Room was VERY noisy. I should have gotten a hotel on the El line as that would have been quieter. I am a Select Guest and with that receive the beverages and newspaper in the morning. The hotel must not have enough trays/services to go around as they called me to put it out for them to retrieve. Same thing happened later in the evening after ordering room service. I love staying at Omni Hotels but I dislike this one very much. I feel the quality isn't up to par due to dirty linen, noisiness, and the interruption during my stay to retrieve trays/dishes. I will post a comment on the restuarant but will post that separately on Yelp.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Cox2mjShepherd_MI
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for three nights, and we will definitely make this our go-to hotel for any future trips to Chicago. The hotel is very nice, right on Michigan Avenue near Water Tower, John Hancock, Crate and Barrel. Rooms are all suites, which was great for us with 2 younger kids. Our suite was one of the basic ones -- clean, nice beds, comfy pillows, a little cramped, but comfortable. And we were on the 20th floor with great views of MI ave and the John Hancock Tower. But what really made our stay great was the service. You wouldn't necessarily think this would be a kid-friendly hotel, based on the appearance and clientele, but from the moment we stepped out of our car, staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, from the way they remembered our names, to the doorman's greeting my 5-year-old son with a high five each time he saw him. Both kids were given a backpack with toys on arrival, and there were other special touches like milk and cookies at bedtime. We are members of the 'select guest' program (free), so there were nice perks that came with that as well (free wireless, morning beverages delivered to the room). But probably the nicest thing was a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate cake delivered to our room on our anniversary. We were amazed, as were our kids, and that sealed the deal for us. It was a wonderful trip, and the Omni was the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: HonestSalsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Chicago for about 10 days in late Sept.Â We are in our late 30's. We both agreed that you just can't beat the location. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to just about anywhere you want to go, i.e. high end stores, an upscale mall and fabulous restaurants. Make sure to stop by the Purple Pig to have some wine and cheese for lunch or a wonderful dinner. The customer service was great. Everyone from the concierge and the front desk to the housekeeping staff were very nice, accommodating and friendly. Anything and everything was taken care of promptly and smoothly. For example, there was a lightbulb out in the closet, and they fixed it right away. The concierge was always available and very helpful for show tickets, reservations and great recommendations. It was quite easy to get into a cab quickly. The Valets worked very hard to hail a cab and were very nice. Let's face it, even the top hotels can and do have poor customer service. So, the fact that the staff at this hotel was so helpful and friendly was a huge plus! Now, let's talk about the interior of the hotel rooms. This is an all suites hotel and I can only vouch for the room that we stayed in but I think that the suites are all similar. So, the square footage of the room is quite large for a Chicago hotel and especially at the reasonable price that we paid. But, by dividing the room into a sitting room and a bedroom, this creates two small cramped rooms. The sitting area is nice, but we didn't spend much time there and so it was a big waste. Also, the sitting room had a great flat screen TV that was useless. The bedroom had a small old school TV and every night I wished I could have swapped it for the one in the sitting area. The bedroom also hardly had any room to walk around the bed. I kept tripping on the bed cover every night while going around the bed to get to the bathroom. Each day, I couldn't wait to get out of that bedroom. It was such a shame because the room is really a spacious room without the division. They should have taken out the division, lost the Suite title, had only one Flat screen TV and the room would have had a much more spacious inviting feeling. Also, the interior could use some updating and modernizing. Make sure to sign up online for the Select Guest Program through the hotel website before you make the reservation. First of all, it's totally free and there could be some special room rates or specials. You accumulate points towards free stays. The best part of all is that you get a ton of free benefits during your stay. First of all, you will get free Coffee/Tea, water and Juice delivered fresh to your door every morning at the time that you specify. Also, you have free shoe shine and pressing, free WiFi and a select guest representative assigned to you if you should have any concerns or issues. Â  The gym is pretty good and a decent size. Don't come to this hotel for the Pool and jacuzzi. We went there several nights and the Chlorine was so high in the pool but especially in the jacuzzi that we had to get out. This was the case every single time we were there and my eyes were burning so badly for an hour afterwards. It was as if they just opened up a bottle of Chlorine and just poured galloons of it in there. Trust me It Was Bad!! We didn't try the restaurant for dinner or drinks but my husband picked up a sandwich to go for lunch one day and it was delicious but pricey. We did try room service for dinner once and it was great and prompt.Â  If you are allergic to pets, make sure to request a non Pet room and have them do a special cleaning of that room before your arrival just in case. Also, we were not facing Michigan Avenue and overall our room was pretty quiet. I would imagine that a room facing Michigan Avenue would be much noisier. Also, if you are allergic to down feathers, you can request all foam for your room in advance. For a $10/day rental fee, you can request a mini refrigerator for your room. We did and found it very useful. There is a Trader Joes within walking distance and a Whole Foods nearby if you want to get some snacks and food for the room. As a side note, make sure to see the main stage show at Second City, eat at Gibson's, Sushi Samba and take a Boat River tour but only if it's a nice day out. All in all, we liked this hotel and would probably stay again because of the location, the friendly and helpful staff and especially if the price was right again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard not to like this place”
Reviews.Author: WNYer
Reviews.Content: The city of Chicago is fabulous which makes a trip memorable on its own, but having a good hotel experience is just as important. The Omni was great on many fronts, but what makes it most special is their staff. Friendly, helpful, professional. One doorman in particular was top notch. He hooked us up with the hotel car to get to the MSI....very attentive, he knew his guests. Jennifer who is on point for the loyalty program is very good. She was right on top of greeting us and made sure to recognize our wedding anniversary....very nice. Conceirge - extremely helpful and pleasant. Location is ideal...just perfect. We have two young kids and we were able to walk up and down Michigan Ave. to shop, eat, parktake in parade activities with no problem. I do have a couple of comments regarding housekeeping, but they will not sway my decision to choose the Omni again on a return trip. Our bathroom could have used a better cleaning. I'm obsessed with germs so I quickly found a cleaning cart to swipe the disenfectant and began with the tv remotes, light switches, door knobs, and of course the tub and toilet....I know it's vacation, but since I forgot my clorox wipes, it made me feel more comfortable in the room. I'd would do this anywhere. Also, the top comforter was a tad soiled which is not unusual since I know they don't clean these every day. I called housekeeping and within minutes a clean one was delivered (although not as nice). Also, The doors of the hotel are so loud. They seem to slam shut and one night we turned in a bit early and slam, slam, slam...ugh. With this said, overall, I would stay there again. I think it's the people at the Omni that make it as good as it is. I felt spoiled and loved every minute of it. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: Cheak
Reviews.Content: Very classy, hospitable, and impeccable service from the moment we stepped out of our vehicle. We were treated like royality. We stayed the weekend for the Lights Fest in Michigan Ave. They had gifts for our children. We were accommodated with early arrival. Michigan Ave. are at the doorstep. We took a nice walk then went to their Boardroom and viewed the parade in nice cozy festive room with hot chocolate, coffee, hot cider & cookies galore! They went the extra mile to prepared our sheets & children's bears . Thank you Omni for making great memories for our children!

Reviews.Title: “LUxury Hotel, Luxury Service”
Reviews.Author: tripper42256
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for the money and service. Everyone was so nice, turn down service was great and the valet man was so frinedly, opening our doors and taking the trash from us even. Beds were the most comfy I have ever had at a hotel stay. And the bath towels were actually big enough to cover you! None of those small gym size towels there. Not to mention the free apples in the lobby! Would stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Valorentz
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Chicago and stayed at the Omni Chicago Hotel. It was perfect. The hotel is close to everything we wanted to do and see. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the room was outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vinicius-Paganini
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and 5 ys old son stayed 10 nights on this excellent hotel. It is all suites, so the rooms are very confortable. The staff is very polite, with excellent front desk and concierge. The hotel have a good fitness center and a nice heated pool that my son loves it! The stay was more confortable, because I'm member of its loyalty program, the SELECT GUEST. It gives you a free in-room wifi and 2 complimentary beverage for each adult guests. For me this is a really loaylty program, because we can use it and there is REAL benefits!! The location is very good, at the Michigan Av., close to excelent restaurants and walking distance from the major attractions That is a good value as the rooms are suites and very confortable. So we have a lot of fun and we hope to return to this excelent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...so so room”
Reviews.Author: Fitmama1
Reviews.Content: The Omni was very sweet to my daughter and her friend. When we arrived the kids go a 'back pack' of fun items. On the flip side, my other two friends and their daughters didn't received the same item, so there were some boo boo lips. The staff was super friendly on check in both front desk and the gentlemen at the door. The room was a bit of a disappointment. We booked the suite. The bedroom was a bit cramped, and the sitting room was a bit odd. They had a couch and desk with wet bar. There was this huge space that it seemed something belonged. Additional seating would have been very helpful. Once the couch was pulled out, there went any seating. Was bummed there wasn't a refrigerator or microwave. They did bring a refrigerator up after we asked, which was nice. Unfortunately it didn't work, so the wonderful Italian dinner leftovers we brought back with us had to be tossed the next morning. The room was a bit worn looking. Not what I was expecting for the type of star hotel the Omni is rating. Workout facilities were great. Very bright and clean. Wished they did have some wipes or spray bottles to clean the workout equipment when we were done. Kids loved the pool, though is was not big by any means. The fact it was shallow all the way thru made it easier to manage the children. All in all, I loved the friendly staff, but didn't see the dollar value at all.

Reviews.Title: “The in room WiFi is the WORST I have...”
Reviews.Author: twinfallspuddle
Reviews.Content: The in room WiFi is the WORST I have found in ANY hotel EVER. Support is off site and there really isn't anything they can do (except install more wifi hubs). The WiFi signal on the rooms is ridiculously low and cuts out frequently. So much so that I am writing this review on my iPhone with 3G. DO NOT STAY HERE if you are in Chicago in business or otherwise if you have any need for internet. I'm in 2109 just outside the elevators where there's supposed to be a WiFi transmitter and it is impossible.

Reviews.Title: “luxury at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: tkrowley65
Reviews.Content: my stay at the omni, was by far, my most pleasant experience yet in Chicago. The room was beautiful and the staff was the best. It was also very affordable, and no more expensive than other, less luxurious hotels downtown, through online discount booking. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nina3333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a fantastic place for those people visiting Chicago for leisure purposes, and who wish to be close to tourist activities. The hotel is in a beautiful building and the inside of the hotel is quite lovely as well.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent (mile) location!”
Reviews.Author: mirabella626
Reviews.Content: The Omni in Chicago is a great hotel. Wonderful location and service! You can walk everywhere from here and the train is very close as well. All of the shops on the Magnificent Mile are a few blocks away and so is the lake. We loved the all-suite concept. I could go to bed while my husband stayed up watching TV in the other room. The room was clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was a roomy size. The beds were large and comfortable too! We liked using the pool and hot tub to wind down at night (both indoor) and the gym was adequate as well. We were on the 20th floor but could still hear sirens and construction noise. They are building a new hotel next door so you might want to look into the progress of that before booking. Chicago is a beautiful city with so much to see and do. I highly recommend renting bikes and ride along the lake shore path. We also did the Wendella architecture boat tour â€“ fantastic! Of course, we caught a game at Wrigley and it was so easy to get there on the train from the hotel. Just get off at Addison! You should allow some time for the museums as well, we did not and wished we had. They are all located near one and another and seem to have a lot to offer. Try the museum hopper pass, it will save you a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Staff, a little outdated in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: RRRPRT
Reviews.Content: The location is good. The rooms are small and outdated. All in All ok for Chicago Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Chose this hotel for value in center of city”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been fully renovated and provides excellent quality of food, service and value in the center of Chicago. However, being an older building, it is not very soundproof and not recommended for light sleepers. On the lower floors with windows facing Michigan Avenue, the noise is unbearable. It seems there is an ambulance station nearby and they run with sirens blasting at all hours of the night. After we requested a change of room from 7th floor to 17th floor and from front of building to the back of the building, this problem was solved. But, there are many utility rooms and stairways that have very loud metal doors...we looked around and it looks like there is no guest room that is not near one of these doors. In both rooms we had, staff started slamming doors very early in the morning, frequently going in and out of these stairways and utility rooms. Given the property handicap of the type of doors, one would think the staff would be more sensitive to travel gently during the wee hours of the night and morning. All in all, we felt that for the price, this hotel is of excellent quality and value...just not for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bebestic
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Omni Chicago for five nights (second time in four months) and i did enjoy the service given by the staff again. As a select guest, check in was pretty quick. Also the house keeping staff are always extremely concerned about the cleanliness of the room. (Cheers to the housekeeping manager Cassandra and Tony) The hotel isn't modern in terms of decor but the customer service compensates for this. The best attraction to me is its central location, right on Michigan Avenue. This gives you access to whatever your interest might be - shopping, theater, restaurants, Navy Pier etc. It is worthy of note that as a select guest, you're entitled to free internet access and two complementary morning beverage daily.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: gilly39
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to Ireland from the Omni Hotel Chicago and all i have to say is excellent...from the moment we entered the lobby the staff were just so friendly they couldnt do enough for us. We stayed at the Omni for 3 nights and the only regret i have is that we didnt stay longer, our room was just amazing spotless with all the extras. The location is just perfect right on Michigan avenue where you will find plenty of shops ranging from designer shops to retail shops suitable for all. The city of Chicago was amazing and to top it all the weather was just fab. I would return to this hotel without question and if i ever get the chance to return to Chicago i would certainly be returning to the Omni Hotel Chicago...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I ever visit!!”
Reviews.Author: 9622Maria
Reviews.Content: I have just returned to Sweden after a 10 day stay at the OMNI Hotel in Chicago. The purpose of the visit was to celebrate my mothers 70th birthday. I must say that I have never been treated better in a hotel! What a great staff and what an exelent service! I have lived in many first class hotels around the world, but OMNI Hotel beats the most of them! You felt so welcome already when you stepped out from the cab, the check-in was quick and we received a great room at the 22nd floor (2207) with a spectacular view. The room was very nice decorated and very,very clean. We also went to the restaurant (676) both for brekfast and for the birthday dinner! I can higly recomend this restaurant, great food and very, very nice staff. I have been in Chicago before and then lived at Hilton Pamer House but I must say that OMNI Hotel has a much nicer approach to their guests! They always great you with a smile and wish you a nice day! I will definitely stay here the next time a visit chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: TSN_10
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to stay at the Omni based on feedback from friends & Trip Advisor. It is a great location, making it easy to make your way around Chicago. The check in went very smoothly and the service at that point was excellent. We were checked in to room 918. Very disappointing. It had water damage around the pillar (on the ceiling) and stained carpet around the perimeter of the room. It also smelled very musty. This was not the first impression we were expecting. We called and asked to switch rooms, explaining the problem. Christina at the front desk apologized and switched our rooms without any hassle. Room #2- 1118. It looked good- we felt we could go & explore Chicago. After a few hours we returned to the room for a rest prior to meeting friends. When I pulled back the bed cover & sheets, there were 5 dried blood stains on the white sheets. (Along with small holes in the sheets). This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel? I called the desk and asked for a room without blood stained sheets or a musty, water damaged room. Christina apologized and said she would send up the housekeeping supervisor. A gentleman entered the room and told me the blood stains were "rust due to the washing machine". Completely insulting.... you could see the imprint of the blood. Why would rust stains be on sheets and why would they put them on a bed in a hotel room? Especially with the hype about bed bugs at this time. I was not impressed by this man at all.... Christina then moved us to room 2518. It was finally clean..... The rooms are poorly laid out. (Closet in the bathroom) I would not rate this hotel 4 stars. We stayed at the Hyatt 3 years ago in Chicago and had a much better experience. (Omni has the better location) I will not stay here again. For all of the great reviews, we were very excited for our trip to Chicago. This is the first time in 10 years I have disagreed with the Trip Advisor reviews on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel with the best service in the country!”
Reviews.Author: pedheartrn
Reviews.Content: We stay here every December to enjoy the city and do some shopping. The hotel has some good deals around that time of year. We love taking our daughter to the American Girl store and walking around the Mag Mile admiring the decorations. This particular Omni (we've stayed at others) has the absolute best service hands-down. Most polite & accomodating staff - they actually remember us even though we only come once a year!

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret your stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TEEMAC125
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel. This was his first time to Chicago. We couldn't have found a better hotel, for both hospitality, cleanlines and proximity. Let me add here that I am 5 mo pregnant, so I was concerned about walking. First, when I reserved the room, over the phone, I was asked when I would be arriving so we could get an early check in (some hotels in Chicago charge up to $100 for an early check in). The rooms don't have microwaves or fridges, but you can "rent" them. I requested both, but wasn't charged for either. The rooms were very clean (something I am VERY big on--especially the showers). The front desk staff were AWESOME....very welcoming and accomondating. Now on to shopping.....if you are going there to SHOP, you can't find a better location. You are 1-4 blocks in any direction from Tiffany, Apple, Nine West, Nike Town, Salvatore Ferragamo, Hugo Boss, American Girl, Filenes Basement, Express, Burberry, TheWater Tower Building (mall) to name a few. Great restuarants w/in 1 block, Giardano's, TGIFridays and Rosebuds. A few blocks is the Weber Grill. Garretts Popcorn is 2 blocks away. I would recommend doing the Double decker bus tour......it gives you some insight into the area attractions and allows you to get on and off at the different attractions so you save on taxi fare...which is expensive. If you don't want to spend a lot on breakfast at the hotel eat at the Corner Bakery or Yolk, both are just a few blocks away. Yes you hear the occasional ambulance, because of the hospital down the street, but it wasn't bad at all. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our room; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: norskie54
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the Omni. It was a wonderful stay. I saw a recent review complaining about the maid service. I've never contributed a review on this site, but I check tripadvisor whenever I make a lodging choice. I must say that our experience with the attention our room received was nothing like what this guest described. Our bathroom was spotless and we were impressed that each evening when we returned from dinner, the maid had freshened our room which included turn-down service and supplying fresh towels. LOVED the free beverage delivery in the morning (if you join the Omni loyalty club which is free). Each morning had fresh grapefruit juice and a pot of coffee. Free New York Times too! The bed and bedding were wonderful. We enjoyed the suite-style set-up. I was up early and could close the french doors to the bed area. Check out nearby Rush Street for fun evening action and all kinds of restaurant options. We had a peek-a-boo view of the lake and loved our 23rd floor room. If you are a shopper, you'll be in Nirvana in this location. We walked to Millenium Park, walked to Old Town, walked to see the Gold Coast mansions, walked to the lake. If long walks don't work for you, the bus is easy on Michigan Ave and the El is just a couple of blocks away. We rented bikes at Bobby's and had such a fun day riding the lake trail up past Lincoln park -- destination: the Swedish Bakery and Wrigley Field. If you can get a good rate, stay at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_T16
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a nice hotel, but our room was VERY noisy! We paid extra for a corner room - pretty room, but definately not worth the extra money. We were on the 20th floor and had a nice view on 1 side of the room (facing Michigan Ave), but the other 2 windows just looked at a building that was NOT exciting at all. The big TV and DVD player were in the "living room" of the 2 room suite, the TV in the bedroom (the only one we watched) was very tiny and old with a "sticky" remote. WARNING - if you are staying at the Omni, do NOT get a room anywhere near Michigan Ave!!! Ambulances and fire trucks run up Michigan Ave with their sirens blaring about every 20 minutes ALL DAY AND NIGHT! Even on the 20th floor we couldn't sleep because of the constant sirens - we were up most of the night and finally gave up at 5:00 am (the taxi drivers also started blaring their horns around 6:00 AM). We've never stayed in Chicago before, but after taking very long walks and checking out the area, we definately would have looked into staying at some other hotels that looked much newer and were in seemingly quieter areas (not on Michigan Ave). The staff at the Omni was very friendly and extended our check-out until 2:00 PM so that we didn't have to check out before we had to leave for the airport - we really appreciated that! The stay was "OK," but we've stayed at other hotels in other cities for less money that were much more comfortable and spacious (and had a better room service menu - $15 for a bagel and coffee - NOT!).

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Freddie088
Reviews.Content: From making the reservations to check-out, I experienced nothing but friendliness and professionalism. Aside for the uncomfortable pull-out sofa/bed in my room, the accommodations were more than adequate. Housekeeping staff extremely attentive and thorough. If ever back in the Windy City, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in everyway”
Reviews.Author: LadyGrey68
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay at the Omni Hotel with my husband and daughter (in her 20's). From the moment we arrived to when we departed we thanked our lucky stars that we had booked this hotel. From the front door staff through to housekeeping we have never encountered such pleasant, friendly, helpful and courteous staff. Omni management - you should be very proud of all your staff - but in particular Jacob. He went out of his way to be helpful to us and always with a genuine welcome and smile. We were met at reception by a lovely lady with a great smile (and a fabulous swarovski ring my daughter went la la about!! ) and check in was quick and efficient. Our bags were brought up to our room quickly. The location of the Omni is perfect as you just walk around the corner and you are on Michegan ave - opposite the Apple store and a short walk north to the John Hancock building and 900 mall and south to shops at North Bridge, Wrigley building and water taxis. Navy Pier is approx 15-20mins walk and well worth the walk - its a fantastic place to spend the afternoon and our bonus was the air show was on that weekend - fabulous. We also took in the Blue Man group show, tickets to which the concierge at the Omni arranged for us. Concierge service there is second to none and will do bookings or check timetables - any info you want they will get for you. We loved our room on the 19th floor - a corner suite which looked out on Huron st. King size bed in our room and so very comfortable. Our room was spotless as was the entire hotel and housekeeping came everyday with fresh towels. We loved the turndown service each evening - so welcoming to come back to after a long day sightseeing or shopping. We joined the select guest service and got free newspaper and selection of 2 drinks per guest each morning delivered to the room. Nice pool and gym although pool is a little on the small side. We did not eat at the hotel as there are so many great places to eat within walking distance - Eggsperience on 35 W Ontario is not to be missed especially for breakfast - wow you will not need to eat for the rest of the day. It is reasonably priced and staff are extremely pleasant and friendly. Also The Rose Bud italian on North Rush st where the food is top class and service excellent and prices good. We loved everything about Chicago and cant wait to go back - the shopping and sightseeing were brilliant but the Omni Hotel was best of all 5* and will our first choice when we hit Chicago again - hopefully that will be real soon!!!! I highly recommend this hotel - like us you wont be sorry. Thank you Omni - take a bow.

Reviews.Title: “Do not accept Room 516!”
Reviews.Author: MrEcosse
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay seven nights for a vacation in Chicago. Having saved on the the flights we decided to upgrade our hotel to the Omni. On arrival we were allocated room 516. This has to be the worst room in the hotel. There is a sundeck on floor 5 meaning directly outside our windows people were walking by all day - absolutely no privacy. Then the gym is directly next door to the room and is noisy. Add to that the wireless internet didn't work. And finally the hotels own music starts playing outside the hotel at 5am and you can clearly hear it in the room. Why would a hotel who has guests staying for seven nights put them in such a bad room? Of course we were going to complain - they must have known that? So guess what I am now telling the world to avoid the 5th floor at this hotel at all costs. The next morning we did complain about the room. The receptionist said she could do nothing about it until we had spoken to the manager. Whilst they offered to phone us we felt it would be too easy for them to reject our request for a move over the phone. After waiting an hour in the lobby we approached the desk again. This time the other receptionist said that she could authorise the request to move. Why the first receptionist hadn't asked the second is anyone's guess? It's a great example how one poor or poorly trained member of staff can affect the reputation of the entire hotel. When we were moved (to the 20th floor) the room was fine. On departure there was an item on the bill from the room bar that we hadn't used. This was removed without fuss but shouldn't have been on the bill in the first place. Also on checkout the receptionist on duty mentioned that if we joined the loyalty program we could get our internet for free. Since one of the reasons for wanting to move rooms was the Internet why had none of the other staff mentioned this. We signed up and the charge was credited to our account. Marco, I'm not sure what you do in your hour long stand up meetings each day? But it doesn't seem to be providing consistent and good customer service at the front desk. There were just too many errors on the customer service side to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: FAMM2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Omni Chicago for 4 fabulous nights. We loved the hotel, the service, the elegant surroundings, the location. Everything was very good. Specially Marco (Manager at the Front Desk) made our stay excellent. He helped us with a nice room and even when the room wasn't ready he was so polite and apologized, he personally took our luggage so we didn't have to deal with anything else. Within a hour he called my husband to let us know that the room was ready. When my husband and I came back to the hotel we were expecting to deal with luggage again but Marco placed the luggage in the room so we just picked up the keys at the front desk. I had very high expectations and they were met by Marco pretty much!! If you are looking to treat yourself in a great city like Chicago, I don't think you could go past this hotel, however just make sure you contact Marco to ensure a great stay! All that said, the 4 star quality of the experience at this hotel is very consistent and better than other venues of similar rating, but which is a better is the service!! Stay there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: trigeekgirl236
Reviews.Content: We got the Omni on a pretty good deal thanks to priceline, so I might feel different about things if we hadn't, but since we did, I liked it a lot.
